entry.name: AcquireTile
entry.value: Acquire Tile

entry.name: AcquireTileDescription
entry.value: Acquires a new tile for the city. Buildings can only be built on acquired tiles. Each tile has an influence upkeep.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/AggressionOverride
entry.value: Aggression Override

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/AggressionOverrideDescription
entry.value: Increases the attacks of target allied Adeptus Mechanicus infantry unit.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/AggressionOverrideFlavor
entry.value: Employing data-refined kill-canticle protocols, the Marshal ensures his Skitarii are driven into a state of heightened ferocity that sees their bloodstreams boil with combat hyperstimulants.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/AggressorImperative
entry.value: Aggressor Imperative

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/AggressorImperativeDescription
entry.value: Increases the movement, but decreases the armour of Doctrina Imperatives units. Cost scales with the amount of affected units (up to 10).

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/AggressorImperativeFlavor
entry.value: The Skitarii feel the press of an invisible hand upon their minds as the Machine God drives them forward. Servos are pushed to their structural limits as fibre bundles fill with the boundless energy of the Motive Force and propel the faithful on an unstoppable crusade.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/BenedictionOfOmniscience
entry.value: Benediction of Omniscience

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/BenedictionOfOmniscienceDescription
entry.value: Increases the ranged accuracy of Canticles of the Omnissiah units. Cost and effectiveness scales with the amount of affected units (up to 10).

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/BenedictionOfOmniscienceFlavor
entry.value: Those blessed enough to comprehend this blaring vox-prayer find their targeting reticules guided by the Omnissiah’s own vigilance.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/BroadSpectrumDataTether
entry.value: Broad Spectrum Data-Tether

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/BroadSpectrumDataTetherDescription
entry.value: Reduces the morale loss of this unit and adjacent allied Adeptus Mechanicus units.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/BroadSpectrumDataTetherFlavor
entry.value: A vehicle-mounted version of that carried by veteran Skitarii, the broad spectrum data-tether projects a Tech-Priest’s binharic blurts with such clarity it seems he is amongst the ranks of the Skitarii himself. Imperatives delivered via such information relays are more potent and reliable than any other.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/BulwarkImperative
entry.value: Bulwark Imperative

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/BulwarkImperativeDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour, but decreases the movement of Doctrina Imperatives units. Cost scales with the amount of affected units (up to 10).

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/BulwarkImperativeFlavor
entry.value: The warrior wisdom of ancient and experienced Reductors is force-loaded into the Skitarii’s minds. Each thrilling pulse of data locks microactuators into bracing positions, brings reserve power cells online and bestows a sensation of sacred invulnerability upon the Tech-Priests’ soldiers.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ChantOfTheRemorselessFist
entry.value: Chant of the Remorseless Fist

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ChantOfTheRemorselessFistDescription
entry.value: Increases the melee accuracy of Canticles of the Omnissiah units. Cost and effectiveness scales with the amount of affected units (up to 10).

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ChantOfTheRemorselessFistFlavor
entry.value: In spitting out a staccato chant to the Motive Force, the faithful warriors of the Cult Mechanicus are filled with merciless surety as well as intent.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/CommandUplink
entry.value: Command Uplink

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/CommandUplinkDescription
entry.value: Reduces the morale loss of this unit and adjacent allied Adeptus Mechanicus units.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/CommandUplinkFlavor
entry.value:
“You may feel fear, you may want to flee; but when your Magos can, with a thought, stop your limbs taking a single step back, well, then you fight anyway.”
—Marshal Diktum

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ConquerorImperative
entry.value: Conqueror Imperative

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ConquerorImperativeDescription
entry.value: Increases the melee accuracy, but decreases the ranged accuracy of Doctrina Imperatives units. Cost scales with the amount of affected units (up to 10).

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ConquerorImperativeFlavor
entry.value: When the enemy close in, the Tech-Priests controlling each maniple inload Conqueror imperatives that boost the martial subroutines of their Skitarii minions and galvanise them into physical action at the expense of their more elaborate targeting programmes.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ControlEdict
entry.value: Control Edict

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ControlEdictDescription
entry.value: Removes Doctrina Imperatives malus from allied infantry units in range.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ControlEdictFlavor
entry.value: A Doctrina Imperative is hardly a subtle tool, disabling a soldier just as much as it enables them elsewhere. Yet, the attentions of an experienced Marshal can aid in overcoming the Imperative’s cruder commands, enabling the soldier to perform far above their nominal norms.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/DataBlessedAutosermon
entry.value: Data-Blessed Autosermon

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/DataBlessedAutosermonDescription
entry.value: Canticles of the Omnissiah units in the area grant research when killing enemies.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/DataBlessedAutosermonFlavor
entry.value: Struck with an infoload of revelation, truly blessed Tech-Priests will override the sacred canticles to deliver the Machine God’s adaptive wisdom.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ElectroShockedDescription
entry.value: Stuns target enemy infantry or monstrous creature.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ElectroShockedFlavor
entry.value: The truly devout can send a sudden charge of the Motive Force pulsing through their numerous augmentations, stunning nearby foes.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/EnrichedRounds
entry.value: Enriched Rounds

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/EnrichedRoundsDescription
entry.value: Increases the damage of target allied Adeptus Mechanicus infantry unit.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/EnrichedRoundsFlavor
entry.value: Sanctified with the Tri-fold Litany, each of these slugs has spent a decade in the oldest and most irradiated forge temple to certify their lethality. When the Marshal hands them out to his maniples, they know they must make every shot count.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/GalvanicField
entry.value: Galvanic Field

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/GalvanicFieldDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of target allied Adeptus Mechanicus unit.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/GalvanicFieldFlavor
entry.value: Using the Motive Force contained within a large galvanic cell, the Manipulus’s electropositors can infuse the weaponry of nearby allies with the underlying current of all life, carrying the Omnissiah sacred benedictions forward to cast all heretics down.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/IncantationOfTheIronSoul
entry.value: Incantation of the Iron Soul

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/IncantationOfTheIronSoulDescription
entry.value: Reduces the morale loss of Canticles of the Omnissiah units. Cost and effectiveness scales with the amount of affected units (up to 10).

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/IncantationOfTheIronSoulFlavor
entry.value: Raising their voices in binharic praise, the Disciples of the Machine God bolster their spirits with the surety of iron.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/InvocationOfMachineMight
entry.value: Invocation of Machine-Might

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/InvocationOfMachineMightDescription
entry.value: Increases the melee damage of Canticles of the Omnissiah units. Cost and effectiveness scales with the amount of affected units (up to 10).

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/InvocationOfMachineMightFlavor
entry.value: The Tech-Priests lead their minions in a binharic prayer that sends miraculous strength surging through tendons, wires and pistons.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/LitanyOfTheElectromancer
entry.value: Litany of the Electromancer

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/LitanyOfTheElectromancerDescription
entry.value: Damages target enemy unit. Attacks and cost scales with the amount of Canticles of the Omnissiah units (up to 10).

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/LitanyOfTheElectromancerFlavor
entry.value: Summoning the spark of the Machine God’s divinity that burns within them, the Omnissiah’s faithful manifest blazing auras of energy that lay low the unbeliever.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/LordOfTheMachineCult
entry.value: Lord of the Machine Cult

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/LordOfTheMachineCultDescription
entry.value: Increases the accuracy of adjacent Adeptus Mechanicus vehicle units.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/LordOfTheMachineCultFlavor
entry.value:
“You may say, it is impossible for a man to become like the Machine. And I would reply, that only the smallest mind strives to comprehend its limits.”
—Fabricator General Kane

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/MasterOfMachines
entry.value: Master of Machines

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/MasterOfMachinesDescription
entry.value: Restores the hitpoints of the target allied Adeptus Mechanicus, vehicle or fortification unit.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/MasterOfMachinesFlavor
entry.value:
“Our enemies may rest but rust never sleeps.”
—Tech-Priest Jung, Forge World Gehenna

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/MechanicusLocum
entry.value: Mechanicus Locum

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/MechanicusLocumDescription
entry.value: Increases the influence and research output.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/MechanicusLocumFlavor
entry.value: Every congregation of Tech-Priests comprises masters of arcane knowledge—zealous leaders of man and machine.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/PowerSurge
entry.value: Power Surge

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/PowerSurgeDescription
entry.value: Increases the ouput of non-headquarters buildings on the target tile.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/PowerSurgeFlavor
entry.value:
“Throw open the transonic oscillator and escalate the dereactor another three points. I require those forges running at optimal efficiency!”
—Archmagos Dyatskin, shortly before the loss of Arklis Hive Primus

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ProtectorImperative
entry.value: Protector Imperative

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ProtectorImperativeDescription
entry.value: Increases the ranged accuracy, but decreases the melee accuracy of Doctrina Imperatives units. Cost scales with the amount of affected units (up to 10).

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ProtectorImperativeFlavor
entry.value: The Protector imperative is codified to yield the maximum spectra of hard data. Extra power is fed into narrow-band optics and rangefinders connected directly to the Skitarii’s priority programming as the holy warriors’ guns become an extension of themselves.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/RadSaturationDescription
entry.value: Damages adjacent enemy infantry and monstrous creature units each turn.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/RadSaturationFlavor
entry.value: Harnessing the destructive energies of forge worlds within their weaponry, certain Skitarii are so soaked in radiation that even to approach them is to confer a death sentence upon yourself. Victory for them is pyrrhic, as this radiation burns through even their heavy armour plate, slowly poisoning them to death even as their carbines bring about the (much quicker) demise of their enemies.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ReprogramKastelanRobot
entry.value: Reprogram Kastelan Robot

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ReprogramKastelanRobotDescription
entry.value: Takes control of the target enemy Kastelan Robot.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ReprogramKastelanRobotFlavor
entry.value: Since the aftermath of Warmaster Horus’ rebellion the Legio Cybernetica’s robots have been controlled completely by their masters – not by the bio-plastic cerebra and nerve-like tendril webs of Mechanicum constructs, but by sanctified doctrina wafers. No bigger than the cards of the Emperor’s Tarot, these slivers of wetware are entrusted to the Cybernetica Datasmiths that accompany the robot maniples to war. Inserted into the dataslot hidden behind each robot’s chestplate, the wafer’s command protocol will dictate every iota of the host’s behaviour, usually optimising its ability to destroy its foes in a spectacular fashion.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ScryerskullDescription
entry.value: Reveals the target tile and adjacent tiles.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ScryerskullFlavor
entry.value: The Adeptus Mechanicus take the assessment and exploitation of battlefield resources very seriously indeed – so much so that many of them continue their work in this role beyond the point of death.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ServoSkullUplink
entry.value: Servo-Skull Uplink

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ServoSkullUplinkDescription
entry.value: Increases the damage of allied Adeptus Mechanicus infantry units in range.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ServoSkullUplinkFlavor
entry.value: It is a great honour for a pious Imperial servant or tech-adept to be converted into a servo skull after death—to have their skull augmented with anti-grav and a rudimentary machine intelligence. Optically-augmented servo skulls like those possessed by a Skitarii Marshal are useful for reconnaissance and targeting, hugely reducing the chance of wasted shots.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ShroudpsalmDescription
entry.value: Increases the ranged damage reduction of Canticles of the Omnissiah units. Cost and effectiveness scales with the amount of affected units (up to 10).

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/ShroudpsalmFlavor
entry.value: Robot, servitor and priest shift their binharic emissions into the visible spectra, the static pouring from their vox-grilles manifesting as an electromagnetic storm that hides them from the foe.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/TechAdeptDescription
entry.value: <string name='Actions/AdeptusMechanicus/MasterOfMachinesDescription'/>

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/TechAdeptFlavor
entry.value: Repairing war engines damaged in the crusade is a holy task.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/VoicesInTheCode
entry.value: Voices in the Code

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/VoicesInTheCodeDescription
entry.value: Increases the morale loss of adjacent enemy units.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/VoicesInTheCodeFlavor
entry.value: Closing with a Sicarian Infiltrator is a mistake—their augmented craniums broadcast a brutally disruptive audiovisual assault, causing enemies to fall deafened and blinded; battles are often decided before even a single kill is confirmed.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/WrathOfMars
entry.value: Wrath of Mars

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/WrathOfMarsDescription
entry.value: Increases the damage of the Tech-Priest Dominus.

entry.name: AdeptusMechanicus/WrathOfMarsFlavor
entry.value: None can smite the blasphemer like those from Mars, for theirs is the most righteous of zeal. All praise the glory of the Machine God!

entry.name: AgileDescription
entry.value: Increases the movement, but decreases the attacks.

entry.name: AgileFlavor
entry.value: Size doesn’t preclude speed. Look at the incredible manoeuvrability of the Imperium’s Lightning Fighter. Or take the Tyranid’s Hierodule. Instead of lumbering forward like a lumpen Ogryn, their focus and grace is closer to that of a Harlequin. A hungry Harlequin the size of a house, admittedly, with acid drool and scytheblade arms the length of a Land Raider, that is. But elegant all the same.

entry.name: AmmoRunt
entry.value: Ammo Runt

entry.name: AmmoRuntDescription
entry.value: Increases the ranged accuracy.

entry.name: AmmoRuntFlavor
entry.value: An ammo runt is a heavily overburdened Gretchin who carries extra ammunition for his master.

entry.name: ArmoriumCherub
entry.value: Armorium Cherub

entry.name: ArmoriumCherubDescription
entry.value: Increases the accuracy.

entry.name: ArmoriumCherubFlavor
entry.value: Cherubim are diminutive flying cyborg constructs created to assist the Emperor's servants, be they scribe or soldier. Among the Adeptus Astartes they are rarely seen outside of the Librarius, save for those few that relay targeting data and carry spare ammunition for Devastator Squads.

entry.name: AssaultDoctrine
entry.value: Deploy Assault Doctrine

entry.name: AssaultDoctrineDescription
entry.value: Chapter tactic that increases the accuracy of Assault Space Marines.

entry.name: AssaultDoctrineFlavor
entry.value:
“Where there is uncertainty, I shall bring light
Where there is doubt, I shall sow faith.
Where there is shame, I shall point atonement.
Where there is rage, I shall show its course.
My word in the soul shall be as my bolter in the field.”
— Litany of Devotion, traditional

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/ProjectedVoidShield
entry.value: Projected Void Shield

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/ProjectedVoidShieldDescription
entry.value: Increases the ranged damage reduction of units in range.

entry.name: AstraMilitarum/ProjectedVoidShieldFlavor
entry.value: The Void Shield is the peak Imperial ranged-defense technology and is normally only mounted on Titans and Superheavy Tanks because of its immense power needs. This variant uses the technology to defend a wide area, though it is useless against melee attacks.

entry.name: AstraMilitarumAircraftProductionEdict
entry.value: Naval Orders

entry.name: AstraMilitarumAircraftProductionEdictDescription
entry.value: Edict that increases the production output of Voidports in the city.

entry.name: AstraMilitarumAircraftProductionEdictFlavor
entry.value: Edict, Departmento Munitorum: to all voidport overseers. Labourer sleep cycles are halved until further notice, production targets are raised. Arbitrators are being deployed to all sectors to ensure compliance.

entry.name: AstraMilitarumDefenseEdict
entry.value: Bulwark of the Emperor

entry.name: AstraMilitarumDefenseEdictDescription
entry.value: Edict that increases the armour of allied units in the city.

entry.name: AstraMilitarumDefenseEdictFlavor
entry.value: Edict, Astra Militarum: to all General Staff, Regimental Commanders, Company Commanders. All units are to be kept under or behind protective cover at all times, even during R&R. Additional resource expenditure for defense repairs is authorised.

entry.name: AstraMilitarumEnergyEdict
entry.value: Running Hot

entry.name: AstraMilitarumEnergyEdictDescription
entry.value: Edict that increases the energy output of Plasma Ionisers in the city.

entry.name: AstraMilitarumEnergyEdictFlavor
entry.value: Edict, Departmento Munitorum: to all power unit overseers. Safeguards are to be removed on all plasma ionisers; the labour Corps has been mandated to replenish manpower depleted by resulting meltdowns without further authorisation.

entry.name: AstraMilitarumFoodEdict
entry.value: Agronomic Surge

entry.name: AstraMilitarumFoodEdictDescription
entry.value: Edict that increases the food output of Soylens Farms in the city.

entry.name: AstraMilitarumFoodEdictFlavor
entry.value: Edict, Departmento Munitorum: to all Imperial subjects. Personal rations are reduced with immediate effect. Arbitrators have been dispatched to farms, granaries and storehouses to ensure compliance.

entry.name: AstraMilitarumGrowthEdict
entry.value: Breeding Licenses

entry.name: AstraMilitarumGrowthEdictDescription
entry.value: Edict that increases the growth rate of the city.

entry.name: AstraMilitarumGrowthEdictFlavor
entry.value: Edict, Departmento Munitorum: to all registered insula keepers. For the period of this Edict, connubial encounters are encouraged. Also, to all Imperial storehouse overseers. For the period of this Edict, anaphrodisiac dosages are to be eliminated from both the food and water supply.

entry.name: AstraMilitarumInfantryProductionEdict
entry.value: Inspired Training

entry.name: AstraMilitarumInfantryProductionEdictDescription
entry.value: Edict that increases the production output of Imperial Barracks in the city.

entry.name: AstraMilitarumInfantryProductionEdictFlavor
entry.value: Edict, Astra Militarum: to all Commissars and recruitment officers. Volunteering sweeps are to be doubled, the Emperor's Mercy is to be applied to all recusants.

entry.name: AstraMilitarumInfluenceEdict
entry.value: Imperial Faith

entry.name: AstraMilitarumInfluenceEdictDescription
entry.value: Edict that increases the influence output of Cogitator Stations in the city.

entry.name: AstraMilitarumInfluenceEdictFlavor
entry.value: Edict, Adeptus Ministorum: All unassigned workers are hereby ordered to report to the nearest Mission, Shrine or Schola Progenium to assist in spreading the word of the Emperor. Pontifices will be on hand for mandatory heresy-testing.

entry.name: AstraMilitarumLoyaltyEdict
entry.value: Propaganda Broadcast

entry.name: AstraMilitarumLoyaltyEdictDescription
entry.value: Edict that increases the loyalty output of Sancti Imperialum in the city.

entry.name: AstraMilitarumLoyaltyEdictFlavor
entry.value: Edict, Adeptus Arbites: to all Commissars, Arbitrators and Enforcers: a period of increased Imperial communication has been commissioned. During this time, insula-to-insula searches are now authorised in order to ensure maximum devotion to the Emperor. Chasteners are to apply the Lex Imperialis rigorously.

entry.name: AstraMilitarumOreEdict
entry.value: Extraction Quotas

entry.name: AstraMilitarumOreEdictDescription
entry.value: Edict that increases the ore output of Ore Extractors in the city.

entry.name: AstraMilitarumOreEdictFlavor
entry.value: Edict, Departmento Munitorum: to all manufactory overseers: servitors are required to be run continuously for this cycle. Burnouts / fatalities are to be replaced from the lower ranks of the penal and labour corps.

entry.name: AstraMilitarumPsykerProductionEdict
entry.value: Coven Foci

entry.name: AstraMilitarumPsykerProductionEdictDescription
entry.value: Edict that increases the production output of Psyker Covens in the city.

entry.name: AstraMilitarumPsykerProductionEdictFlavor
entry.value: Edict, Adeptus Astra Telepathica: to the Coven Masters and magisters of the Scholastia Psykana. Quality thresholds for recruitment have been lowered; summary executions should thus be minimal, blanks excepted. Assign all recruits to a Sanctioned Psyker immediately.

entry.name: AstraMilitarumResearchEdict
entry.value: Revelations of the Omnissiah

entry.name: AstraMilitarumResearchEdictDescription
entry.value: Edict that increases the research output of Officiis Tacticas in the city.

entry.name: AstraMilitarumResearchEdictFlavor
entry.value: Edict, Adeptus Mechanicus: to all Tech-Priests. During this cycle, the Quest for Knowledge takes precedence. Studies of STC designs, exploratory missions are to be encouraged. Praise the Omnissiah!

entry.name: AstraMilitarumVehicleProductionEdict
entry.value: Rites of the Machine Spirits

entry.name: AstraMilitarumVehicleProductionEdictDescription
entry.value: Edict that increases the production output of Manufactorums in the city.

entry.name: AstraMilitarumVehicleProductionEdictFlavor
entry.value: Edict, Adeptus Mechanicus: to all Manufactorum Magi. Production quotas for this period are raised. Personal projects must be put on hold during this time. Additional resources / unguents will be provided for performance of the machine rites. Praise the Omnissiah!

entry.name: AuraOfDiscipline
entry.value: Aura of Discipline

entry.name: AuraOfDisciplineDescription
entry.value: Increases the accuracy of the Lord Commissar and adjacent allied Astra Militarum infantry.

entry.name: AuraOfDisciplineFlavor
entry.value: Should discipline or morale falter, it is the task of the Commissar to take whatever steps necessary to restore order, and to do so in the absolute knowledge that his actions are just. Under the steely gaze of such a man, Imperial Guardsmen must be inspired to deeds they never believed possible.

entry.name: AuraOfFear
entry.value: Aura of Fear

entry.name: AuraOfFearDescription
entry.value: Reduces the morale of adjacent enemy units each turn.

entry.name: AuraOfFearFlavor
entry.value: Some beings are so monstrous or alien that they can force their foes to recoil in horror.

entry.name: AwakenTheMachine
entry.value: Awaken The Machine

entry.name: AwakenTheMachineDescription
entry.value: Increases the ranged accuracy of the target allied vehicle or fortification unit.

entry.name: AwakenTheMachineFlavor
entry.value:
“With push of Button fire the Engine
And spark Turbine into life…
Toll the Great Bell Thrice!
Sing Praise to the
God of All Machines”
— Catechism of the Autoculus of Mars

entry.name: BlessingsOfTheOmnissiah
entry.value: Blessings of the Omnissiah

entry.name: BlessingsOfTheOmnissiahDescription
entry.value: Restores the hitpoints of the target allied vehicle or fortification unit.

entry.name: BlessingsOfTheOmnissiahFlavor
entry.value:
“Thus do we invoke the Machine God.
Thus do we make whole that which was sundered.”
— Hymn of reforging

entry.name: BolsterDefences
entry.value: Bolster Defences

entry.name: BolsterDefencesDescription
entry.value: Increases the ranged damage reduction of the target tile.

entry.name: BolsterDefencesFlavor
entry.value:
“Every position must be held to the last man: there must be no retirement. With our backs to the wall, and believing in the justice of our cause, each one of us must fight on to the end.”
— Imperial Warmaster Solon

entry.name: BolterDrill
entry.value: Deploy Bolter Drill

entry.name: BolterDrillDescription
entry.value: Chapter tactic that increases the accuracy of bolt weapons.

entry.name: BolterDrillFlavor
entry.value:
“I believe in three tenets of battle—firepower, firepower, and more firepower.”
— Kardan Stronos, Chapter Master of the Iron Hands

entry.name: BringItDown
entry.value: “Bring it Down!”

entry.name: BringItDownDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour penetration of the Lord Commissar and adjacent allied Astra Militarum infantry.

entry.name: BringItDownFlavor
entry.value: Enemy war machines and alien monstrosities are equally high priority targets for the commanders of the Imperial Guard.

entry.name: BuyHint
CanticlesOfWrath
entry.value: Canticles of Wrath

entry.name: CanticlesOfWrathDescription
entry.value: Restores the morale of this unit and adjacent allied units and reduces the morale of adjacent enemy units.

entry.name: CanticlesOfWrathFlavor
entry.value: Amplified through his vox grill, the Chaplain's bellicose rhetoric and canticles of wrath echo like thunder across the battlefield, filling the Space Marines with new strength while causing the enemy to cower in terror.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/BoonOfMutation
entry.value: Boon of Mutation

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/BoonOfMutationDescription
entry.value: Target adjacent allied Champion of Chaos unit gains a missing, unlocked Boon of Chaos.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/BoonOfMutationFlavor
entry.value: The psyker lays his hands upon a warrior marked for glory, channeling the warping power of Chaos into his body until his flesh wrenches and flows.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/DarkGlory
entry.value: Dark Glory

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/DarkGloryDescription
entry.value: Increases the damage reduction.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/DarkGloryFlavor
entry.value: Some champions of Chaos are so blessed by their patron deity that they are supernaturally protected from harm. They might be surrounded by a powerful, crackling shield of energy, or else bullets aimed at them may be strangely turned aside just before they strike. In either case, it is clear that the Dark Gods are watching over them.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/DeferredAbsolution
entry.value: Deferred Absolution

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/DeferredAbsolutionDescription
entry.value: Increases the invulnerable damage reduction of adjacent allied Chaos units.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/DeferredAbsolutionFlavor
entry.value: The bowed figures of the Dark Disciples incessantly shriek the names of the Chaos Gods, calling for their protection. Typically fickle, the Gods are prone to bless those nearby instead, leaving the desperate Disciples as frail as ever.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/ExaltedStrike
entry.value: Exalted Strike

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/ExaltedStrikeDescription
entry.value: Performs a devastating Thunder Hammer attack against the target enemy unit with less than 50% hitpoints.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/ExaltedStrikeFlavor
entry.value: To face a Chaos Lord in battle isn’t just to face an elite Adeptus Astartes, or a veteran of ten thousand years of war—it’s to face the best of those few survivors, one also blessed by the gods. After ten millennia, they well know weakness and how to exploit it.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/GiftOfContagion
entry.value: Gift of Contagion

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/GiftOfContagionDescription
entry.value: Deals damage to the target enemy infantry or monstrous creature unit.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/GiftOfContagionFlavor
entry.value: The psyker gathers clouds of contagion and rot-flies about his enemies, granting them Father Nurgle's blessing.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/IchorBlood
entry.value: Ichor Blood

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/IchorBloodDescription
entry.value: Enemies take damage when they cause melee damage.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/IchorBloodFlavor
entry.value: It is not blood that runs through this champion's veins, but searing ichor, molten brass, psychadelic narcotics, virulent pus or some such vile and deadly substance.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfDespair
entry.value: Icon of Despair

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfDespairDescription
entry.value: Icon of Chaos that increases the melee damage reduction against fearful enemies to a unit with Mark of Nurgle.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfDespairFlavor
entry.value: This icon is surrounded by a miasma of disease and hopelessness, turning the thoughts of any nearby foes to the grisly and inevitable deaths that await them.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfExcess
entry.value: Icon of Excess

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfExcessDescription
entry.value: Icon of Chaos that increases the damage reduction of a unit with Mark of Slaanesh.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfExcessFlavor
entry.value: Depravity hangs about this icon like cloying musk, driving those below it into an orgy of sensation-seeking that can only be halted by the total destruction of their bodies.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfFlame
entry.value: Icon of Flame

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfFlameDescription
entry.value: Icon of Chaos that grants “attacks deal Soul Blaze damage each turn” to a unit with Mark of Tzeentch.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfFlameFlavor
entry.value: Coruscating energies surround the icon, swathing the weapons of the devout with mutagenic flames.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfVengeance
entry.value: Icon of Vengeance

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfVengeanceDescription
entry.value: Icon of Chaos that grants Fearless to a unit with any Mark of Chaos.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfVengeanceFlavor
entry.value: These icons shine brightly in the Warp, gathering the malefic energies of Chaos to those who bear them and spurring them on to acts of suicidal brabery in their quest to seize victory from the minions of the Corpse-god.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfWrath
entry.value: Icon of Wrath

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfWrathDescription
entry.value: Icon of Chaos that increases the damage of a unit with Mark of Khorne.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfWrathFlavor
entry.value: The red-hot curses of the Blood God resound in the minds of those in the shadow of this icon, compelling them to hurl themselves into the fray with wild abandon.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/IncursionDescription
entry.value: Summon a temporary random Daemon.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/IncursionFlavor
entry.value: The psyker opens a portal to the Realm of Chaos, allowing the warp's daemonic denizens to spill forth into reality.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/InfernalPower
entry.value: Infernal Power

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/InfernalPowerDescription
entry.value: Increases the accuracy and damage of this unit and adjacent allied Chaos units.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/InfernalPowerFlavor
entry.value: The fell power of the immaterium flows from the psyker, imbuing the Daemons that reside within his followers' bodies with even greater ferocity.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/LoathsomeAura
entry.value: Loathsome Aura

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/LoathsomeAuraDescription
entry.value: Increases the invulnerable damage reduction of adjacent allied Chaos units.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/LoathsomeAuraFlavor
entry.value: A brutal edifice, raised up to destabilise local reality by the forces of Chaos, the Noctilith Crown brings the Warp closer, empowering those attuned to the Dark Gods.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/MalevolentLocus
entry.value: Malevolent Locus

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/MalevolentLocusDescription
entry.value: Damages enemy non-Chaos psykers in range each turn.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/MalevolentLocusFlavor
entry.value: By this twisted construct, the whispers of the Warp are amplified, assaulting the minds of enemy psykers constantly. Few emerge unscathed from the trial.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfKhorne
entry.value: Mark of Khorne

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfKhorneDescription
entry.value: Mark of Chaos that increases the attacks of an allied Chaos non-psyker infantry unit.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfKhorneFlavor
entry.value: The Mark of Khorne is bestowed only upon those whose relentless rage and boundless ferocity pays due homage to the Blood Good's own. To such disciples, Khorne grants an unholy wrath that burns as hot as the stars.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfNurgle
entry.value: Mark of Nurgle

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfNurgleDescription
entry.value: Mark of Chaos that increases the hitpoints of an allied Chaos infantry unit.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfNurgleFlavor
entry.value: Nurgle's blessing manifests not only as a suite of virulent plagues and diseases, but also as the inhuman constitution needed to survive them.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfSlaanesh
entry.value: Mark of Slaanesh

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfSlaaneshDescription
entry.value: Mark of Chaos that increases the movement of an allied Chaos infantry unit.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfSlaaneshFlavor
entry.value: The devotees of Slaanesh have their senses and reactions heightened to a supernatural degree, all the better to drink in the extreme, multifaceted stimuli of the battlefield. A warrior gifted in this manner will move with uncanny grace and speed, his blade lashing out like the tongue of a serpent as he revels in the ugly spectacle of death.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfTzeentch
entry.value: Mark of Tzeentch

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfTzeentchDescription
entry.value: Mark of Chaos that increases the damage reduction of an allied Chaos infantry unit.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/MarkOfTzeentchFlavor
entry.value: Those dedicated to Tzeentch enjoy the protection and prescience of the Master of Manipulation.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/MasterOfMechanisms
entry.value: Master of Mechanisms

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/MasterOfMechanismsDescription
entry.value: Restores the hitpoints of the target allied vehicle or fortification unit.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/MasterOfMechanismsFlavor
entry.value: Despite their array of weaponry, only a Khornate fool would put a Warpsmith directly into battle, when he or she could be better placed repairing and rebinding their Daemon Engine charges.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/MechatendrilsFlavor
entry.value: Reminiscent of the servo-harness worn by the Techmarines of the Adeptus Astrates, these writhing tentacles are worn by—or even implanted into—Chaos Warpsmiths.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/CultistSacrifice
entry.value: Cultist Sacrifice

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/CultistSacrificeDescription
entry.value: Increases the growth rate of target allied Chaos Space Marines city by sacrificing the unit.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/CultistSacrificeFlavor
entry.value: So fervent are the cultists of Chaos but so weak their martial prowess, that the gods enjoy their demise as much as their life—more so, perhaps, given the blessings they bestow at their sacrifice.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/DaemonforgeDescription
entry.value: Sacrifices hitpoints to increase the damage and armour penetration.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/DaemonforgeFlavor
entry.value: The Daemon Engines of the Chaos Space Marines are driven by a fathomless hatred born of the warp.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/DirgeCaster
entry.value: Dirge Caster

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/DirgeCasterDescription
entry.value: Prevents adjacent enemy units from doing overwatch attacks.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/DirgeCasterFlavor
entry.value: This device emits a series of terrifying wails, screams and howls that demoralise and confuse enemies who hear them.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/InfernalIndustry
entry.value: Infernal Industry

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/InfernalIndustryDescription
entry.value: Increases the energy and ore output.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/InfernalIndustryFlavor
entry.value: A Warpsmith is an unparalleled master of technology, without the ethical or historical constraints of their erstwhile peers in the Mechanicum. If they can increase a facility’s functioning at the cost of a few hundred lives, they will.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/LasherTendrils
entry.value: Lasher Tendrils

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/LasherTendrilsDescription
entry.value: Decreases the melee attacks of adjacent enemy units.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/LasherTendrilsFlavor
entry.value: These metallic tendrils entrap their prey in an iron grip.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/PossessionDescription
entry.value: Killing enemy units transforms them into allied Chaos Spawns.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/PossessionFlavor
entry.value: The psyker blasts away their enemy's soul so that the spiritless shell left behind can be possessed by a Daemon, who quickly transforms it into a more pleasing form.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/PrinceOfChaos
entry.value: Prince of Chaos

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/PrinceOfChaosDescription
entry.value: Increases the accuracy of this unit and adjacent allied Chaos units.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/PrinceOfChaosFlavor
entry.value: Little else could more inspire a warrior of Chaos than to see a Daemon Prince—once a mortal just like them, now nearer to a God—fighting alongside them.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/ReservoirOfDaemonicEnergy
entry.value: Reservoir of Daemonic Energy

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/ReservoirOfDaemonicEnergyDescription
entry.value: Reduces the cooldown of Incursion for adjacent allied Masters of Possesion.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/ReservoirOfDaemonicEnergyFlavor
entry.value: Venomcrawlers are uniquely valued both off and on the battlefield. Not only can their repositories of stored warp energy be siphoned in order to create fresh Daemon Engines, but they can be used in the thick of combat to weaken the fabric of reality. Masters of Possession are particularly adept at drawing upon this reservoir to lure the daemonic servants of the Chaos Gods into existence. At battle's end these Daemons are hastily consumed by the Venomcrawler, their essences used to replenish its depleted warp stores.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/RiteOfBlood
entry.value: Rite of Blood

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/RiteOfBloodDescription
entry.value: Sacrifices population to Khorne to increase the production output of units in the city.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/RiteOfBloodFlavor
entry.value: Khorne may have other, minor, traits—a certain nobility and simplicity of war—but his lust for death and blood outweighs them by far. Rites in his name bring not only his blessing, but also increase the work rate of the slave populace, in their terror that they could be next.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/RiteOfChange
entry.value: Rite of Change

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/RiteOfChangeDescription
entry.value: Sacrifices population to Tzeentch to increase the production output of Warp Forges and research output of Archives of the Ways in the city.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/RiteOfChangeFlavor
entry.value: Invoking the Changer’s name is highly risky—few know what he will do to further his endless plans, or the curses he brings if he is distracted to no purpose. After a Rite of Change, some mutate, some disappear, some are embedded alive into the city walls—but always something is learned.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/RiteOfPestilence
entry.value: Rite of Pestilence

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/RiteOfPestilenceDescription
entry.value: Sacrifices population to Nurgle to increase the food output of Renderers and the growth rate in the city.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/RiteOfPestilenceFlavor
entry.value: A Rite of Pestilence doesn’t explicitly sacrifice to Nurgle—it merely invites his blessing upon your people. Given the virulence of Nurgle’s diseases—the Rot, the Chortling Murrain, the Oozing Pox—many will die of these blessings, in his name. Many others will live with them and burgeon with plague-ridden fecundity.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/RiteOfUnholyPleasure
entry.value: Rite of Unholy Pleasure

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/RiteOfUnholyPleasureDescription
entry.value: Sacrifices population to Slaanesh to increase the influence output of Altars of Chaos and loyalty output of Meadows of Sorrow in the city.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/RiteOfUnholyPleasureFlavor
entry.value: Stop your ears with wax, bind your mouth, stitch up your eyes, and tie yourself down. Only then invoke Slaanesh, so that you may not succumb utterly to the Pleasure God’s irresistible desires.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/SacrificeDescription
entry.value: Lose hitpoints to restore the hitpoints of the target allied unit.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/SacrificeFlavor
entry.value: The psyker uses a sacrificial soul to remould and repair an unholy Daemon-form. The tainted spirits of Warpsmiths are particularly invigorating offerings to those Daemon Engines that are in their charge.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/SelfRepairDescription
entry.value: Restores the hitpoints.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/SelfRepairFlavor
entry.value: The machine spirits of the Traitor Legions’ vehicles have long been driven to despair or corrupted by demons, but the surviving vehicles have gained something for that lost—a crude regeneration that stitches the unholy metal back together, so they can continue the work of the Dark Gods.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/ShatterDefences
entry.value: Shatter Defences

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/ShatterDefencesDescription
entry.value: Reduces the ranged damage reduction of the target tile.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/ShatterDefencesFlavor
entry.value: Whatever cover the enemy cowers behind, a Warpsmith can draw upon millennia of siege experience to advise on the best way to bypass or to destroy them.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/WarpflameStrike
entry.value: Warpflame Strike

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/WarpflameStrikeDescription
entry.value: Flies across obstacles to the target tile and blinds adjacent enemy infantry and monstrous creatures.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/WarpflameStrikeFlavor
entry.value: Though the lesion they slice in the fabric of realspace seals over as soon as the hunting pack has passed through, the mind-shattering nature of their attack is usually enough to stun their prey into inactivity. This moment of awestruck hesitation is often fatal, for the hellishly sharp claws of the Warp Talons part heads from necks and limbs from torsos as the hunters hurtle into the ranks of the foe.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/WorthyOffering
entry.value: Worthy Offering

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/WorthyOfferingDescription
entry.value: Increases the chance that this unit and adjacent allied Champions of Chaos receive a Boon of Chaos.

entry.name: ChaosSpaceMarines/WorthyOfferingFlavor
entry.value: Having the eye of the gods upon you means those nearby are also subject to greater scrutiny—whether that turns them to Spawn or Daemon Prince, depends on how well they perform and the inscrutable whim of the Gods.

entry.name: CleansingFlame
entry.value: <string name='Weapons/CleansingFlame'/>

entry.name: CleansingFlameFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Weapons/CleansingFlameFlavor'/>

entry.name: ClearTile
entry.value: Clear Tile

entry.name: ClearTileDescription
entry.value: Restores the tile to its normal state and clears it of wire weed, holy sites, imperial ruins and forests, one at a time.

entry.name: ClusterMines
entry.value: <string name='Weapons/ClusterMines'/>

entry.name: ClusterMinesDescription
entry.value: Places cluster mines on the target adjacent tile to slow and damage enemies.

entry.name: ClusterMinesFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Weapons/ClusterMinesFlavor'/>

entry.name: ConstructBuilding
entry.value: Construct %1%

entry.name: ConstructBuildingHint
ConstructFeature
entry.value: Construct %1%

entry.name: ConstructFeatureHint
ConstructFortification
entry.value: Construct %1%

entry.name: ConstructFortificationHint
ConstructGaussPylon
entry.value: Construct <string name='Units/Necrons/GaussPylon'/>

entry.name: ConstructGaussPylonDescription
entry.value: <string name='Units/Necrons/GaussPylonDescription'/>

entry.name: ConstructGaussPylonFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Units/Necrons/GaussPylonFlavor'/>

entry.name: ConstructImperialStrongpoint
entry.value: Construct <string name='Units/AstraMilitarum/ImperialStrongpoint'/>

entry.name: ConstructImperialStrongpointDescription
entry.value: <string name='Units/AstraMilitarum/ImperialStrongpointDescription'/>

entry.name: ConstructImperialStrongpointFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Units/AstraMilitarum/ImperialStrongpointFlavor'/>

entry.name: ConstructNoctilithCrown
entry.value: Construct <string name='Units/ChaosSpaceMarines/NoctilithCrown'/>

entry.name: ConstructNoctilithCrownDescription
entry.value: <string name='Units/ChaosSpaceMarines/NoctilithCrownDescription'/>

entry.name: ConstructNoctilithCrownFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Units/ChaosSpaceMarines/NoctilithCrownFlavor'/>

entry.name: ConstructTidewallGunrig
entry.value: Construct <string name='Units/Tau/TidewallGunrig'/>

entry.name: ConstructTidewallGunrigDescription
entry.value: <string name='Units/Tau/TidewallGunrigDescription'/>

entry.name: ConstructTidewallGunrigFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Units/Tau/TidewallGunrigFlavor'/>

entry.name: ConstructVoidShieldGenerator
entry.value: Construct <string name='Units/AstraMilitarum/VoidShieldGenerator'/>

entry.name: ConstructVoidShieldGeneratorDescription
entry.value: <string name='Units/AstraMilitarum/VoidShieldGeneratorDescription'/>

entry.name: ConstructVoidShieldGeneratorFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Units/AstraMilitarum/VoidShieldGeneratorFlavor'/>

entry.name: ConstructPlayerAction
entry.value: Construct %1%

entry.name: ConstructPlayerActionHint
CreateSmokeScreen
entry.value: Create Smoke Screen

entry.name: CreateSmokeScreenDescription
entry.value: Increases the ranged damage reduction of the tile.

entry.name: CreateSmokeScreenFlavor
entry.value: Some vehicles have small launchers mounted onto them that carry smoke canisters. These are used to temporarily obscure the vehicle behind billowing clouds of smoke, allowing it to cross open areas in greater safety—although it does so at the cost of being able to fire its own weapons.

entry.name: CycleWeapon
entry.value: Cycle Weapon

entry.name: CycleWeaponDescription
entry.value: Cycle between active weapons.

entry.name: CycleWeaponOnUse
entry.value: Cycle Weapon After Use

entry.name: CycleWeaponOnUseDescription
entry.value: Automatically cycles active weapon after usage.

entry.name: DeedsOfGlory
entry.value: Deeds of Glory

entry.name: DeedsOfGloryDescription
entry.value: When gaining experience from combat the chapter gains influence.

entry.name: DeedsOfGloryFlavor
entry.value:
“It is a captain's duty to place legionary lives in harm's way before his own. There is too little glory in the galaxy to go around and officers must be generous in the trust they place in others—for one day such brothers must be captains too.”
— Rouboute Guilliman, Primarch of the Ultramarines, Lord Commander and Imperial Regent

entry.name: DeployCity
entry.value: Deploy City

entry.name: DeployCityDescription
entry.value:
Operation that deploys the city on the target tile.

Cities can only be deployed where there are no other cities within a %1% tile radius.

entry.name: DeployFortress
entry.value: <string name='Actions/DeployUnit'/>

entry.name: DeployFortressHint
entry.value: <string name='Actions/DeployUnitHint'/>

entry.name: DeployUnit
entry.value: Deploy %1%

entry.name: DeployUnitHint
DevastatorDoctrine
entry.value: Deploy Devastator Doctrine

entry.name: DevastatorDoctrineDescription
entry.value: Chapter tactic that increases the accuracy of Devastator Space Marines and Devastator Centurions.

entry.name: DevastatorDoctrineFlavor
entry.value:
“Victory often rests on the correct weaponry being in the right place and at the right time. Even the most destructive weapons of war are worthless if absent from the battle.”
— Artor Amhrad, Chapter Master of the Astral Knights

entry.name: DisbandDescription
entry.value: Disbands the unit.

entry.name: DispenseChaff
entry.value: Dispense Chaff

entry.name: DispenseChaffDescription
entry.value: Increases the ranged damage reduction.

entry.name: DispenseChaffFlavor
entry.value: Since the earliest days of airborne combat, some form of lightweight material has been used to distract enemy pilots. Today's chaff would be unrecognizable to those early airmen, but its efficacy against modern countermeasures is about the same.

entry.name: DogmaAstrates
entry.value: Dogma Astartes

entry.name: DogmaAstratesDescription
entry.value: Increases the loyalty output of the fortress-city.

entry.name: DogmaAstratesFlavor
entry.value: The Chaplains of the Space Marines are grim spiritual guardians, whose first duty is to be ever watchful for the dangers of pride, doubt and heresy. Daunting even to their own brethren, Chaplains rely on dogma and liturgy to keep their brothers from spiritual corruption.

entry.name: DominateDescription
entry.value: Prevents target enemy infantry or monstrous creature from acting.

entry.name: DominateFlavor
entry.value: The psyker reaches into his foe’s mind, trammelling his soul and crushing his will to fight on.

entry.name: Drukhari/AncientEvil
entry.value: Ancient Evil

entry.name: Drukhari/AncientEvilDescription
entry.value: This unit and Drukhari allied units in range cause attacked units to lose morale.

entry.name: Drukhari/AncientEvilFlavor
entry.value: So long has this Warlord lived, steeped in horror and cruelty, that he is now shrouded in a malefic aura that augments the suffering from his and his army’s attacks.

entry.name: Drukhari/BloodDancer
entry.value: Blood Dancer

entry.name: Drukhari/BloodDancerDescription
entry.value: Increases the melee accuracy.

entry.name: Drukhari/BloodDancerFlavor
entry.value: A star of the Commorrite arenas, the Succubi excel at close quarters combat. The skills they display before the baying crowds on the blood-soaked sands of the arena floor come in equally useful on the battlefield.

entry.name: Drukhari/BonusResources
entry.value: Archon’s Inspection

entry.name: Drukhari/BonusResourcesDescription
entry.value: Soul Hunger ability that increases the ouput of non-headquarters buildings on the target tile.

entry.name: Drukhari/BonusResourcesFlavor
entry.value: It is not as if the Drukhari’s indentured servants ever slacken in their labours. Yet when an Archon turns his gaze upon them, they labour harder, inhumanly so, knowing that a moment’s displeasure will lead to many lifetimes of impossible torment.

entry.name: Drukhari/BridesOfDeath
entry.value: Brides of Death

entry.name: Drukhari/BridesOfDeathDescription
entry.value: Increases the melee damage of this and adjacent Drukhari units.

entry.name: Drukhari/BridesOfDeathFlavor
entry.value: A succubus isn’t just impossibly perfect in appearance, combat and sadism—she also co-ordinates her Wych Cult and other Drukhari impeccably on the battlefield, a choreographer of torment.

entry.name: Drukhari/CombatDrugs
entry.value: Combat Drugs

entry.name: Drukhari/CombatDrugsDescription
entry.value: Gain combat bonuses.

entry.name: Drukhari/CombatDrugsFlavor
entry.value: Though they drastically shorten the life expectancy of the user, chemical stimulants are widely used to heighten combat performance.

entry.name: Drukhari/CrucibleOfMalediction
entry.value: Crucible of Malediction

entry.name: Drukhari/CrucibleOfMaledictionDescription
entry.value: Special long-range attack.

entry.name: Drukhari/CrucibleOfMaledictionFlavor
entry.value: Haemonculi refer to this extraordinary weapon as ‘the kin-gift’, for it is especially dangerous to their psychically attuned craftworld cousins. Each crucible contains the essence of psykers tortured to death. When released, their spirits hurtle across the battlefield, shrieking in a cacophony that drives nearby enemies insane.

entry.name: Drukhari/EnhancedAethersails
entry.value: Enhanced Aethersails

entry.name: Drukhari/EnhancedAethersailsDescription
entry.value: Increases the movement.

entry.name: Drukhari/EnhancedAethersailsFlavor
entry.value: Aethersails are used to capture the aetheric winds that flow out from open webway portals. Many vehicle crews are meticulous in the construction of these sails, incorporating frictionless alloys, vibro-pods and angled booms to enhance their bursts of speed.

entry.name: Drukhari/FieldRepairs
entry.value: Realspace Repairs

entry.name: Drukhari/FieldRepairsDescription
entry.value: Restores the hitpoints.

entry.name: Drukhari/FieldRepairsFlavor
entry.value: A Drukhari trapped in realspace for any time is doomed—She Who Thirsts will slowly sip away their soul until they are a withered husk. So it pays to be able to fix up their craft to ensure a rapid return to the known perils of Commorragh.

entry.name: Drukhari/FleshcraftDescription
entry.value: Restores the hitpoints of an allied Drukhari infantry unit or monstrous creature.

entry.name: Drukhari/FleshcraftFlavor
entry.value: Many Drukhari pass under the knives of a Haemonculus in their lives—many don’t emerge, are turned into Wracks, Grotesques or worse. But the Haemonculi are capable of healing and restoring too—they just find it tremendously dull.

entry.name: Drukhari/GrislyTrophies
entry.value: Grisly Trophies

entry.name: Drukhari/GrislyTrophiesDescription
entry.value: Reduces the morale loss of this unit and adjacent Drukhari units.

entry.name: Drukhari/GrislyTrophiesFlavor
entry.value: Some Drukhari vehicles are adorned with the disembodied heads of slain foes and daubed with copious amounts of enemy blood. The sight of the festering remains of once proud foes instils the Drukhari with arrogant pride.

entry.name: Drukhari/MasterOfPain
entry.value: Master of Pain

entry.name: Drukhari/MasterOfPainDescription
entry.value: Grants additional feel no pain damage reduction to this and adjacent Drukhari infantry units.

entry.name: Drukhari/MasterOfPainFlavor
entry.value: Such exquisite agonies are inflicted by a Haemonculus on its followers that they barely feel their own suffering any more, as oblivious as a follower of Nurgle to the wounds inflicted on their bodies.

entry.name: Drukhari/NoEscape
entry.value: No Escape

entry.name: Drukhari/NoEscapeDescription
entry.value: Reduces the movement of an enemy ground unit.

entry.name: Drukhari/NoEscapeFlavor
entry.value: Arena fighters par excellence, a Succubus is skilled at tormenting their foe, giving it the illusion of escape before reeling it in, so that all watching may savour its suffering and false hope.

entry.name: Drukhari/OverlordDescription
entry.value: Increases the accuracy of this unit and adjacent Drukhari units.

entry.name: Drukhari/OverlordFlavor
entry.value: “I understand your desire, my pets. I understand you wish to increase suffering and pain, so you prolong the moment. For now, though, I require merely death. Focus on that—later, there will be more to kill.” — Gyrthineus Roche, Archon of The Last Blade

entry.name: Drukhari/RaidFromTheWebway
entry.value: <string name='Units/Drukhari/WebwayPortal'/>

entry.name: Drukhari/RaidFromTheWebwayDescription
entry.value: Summon a temporary Webway Portal.

entry.name: Drukhari/RaidFromTheWebwayFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Units/Drukhari/WebwayPortalFlavor'/>

entry.name: Drukhari/RaiderFortress
entry.value: Found Raider Fortress

entry.name: Drukhari/RaiderFortressDescription
entry.value:
Founds city on a claimed Webway Gate.

Cities can only be found where there are no other cities within a %1% tile radius. Each city after the first decreases loyalty in all cities by %2%.

entry.name: Drukhari/RaiderFortressFlavor
entry.value: It is a tribute to the ancient technologies of the fallen Aeldari empire that what appears to the herd races as a mighty city and fortress is to them a mere stopping point, a temporary haven whilst raiding before they return to the Webway and dark Commorragh.

entry.name: Drukhari/ReservoirOfPain
entry.value: Reservoir of Pain

entry.name: Drukhari/ReservoirOfPainDescription
entry.value: Restores the hitpoints of an allied Drukhari infantry unit if this unit attacked this turn.

entry.name: Drukhari/ReservoirOfPainFlavor
entry.value: The Cronos parasite engines are an arcane blend of alchemy and science that leeches both the body and spirit of any victim. Inside its urchin-spined form, the stolen essence is magnified before being redistributed to any nearby Drukhari, refreshing and invigorating them…

entry.name: Drukhari/SacrificeToKhaine
entry.value: <string name='Traits/Drukhari/SacrificeToKhaine'/>

entry.name: Drukhari/SacrificeToKhaineDescription
entry.value: Soul Hunger ability that increases the damage of all Drukhari units.

entry.name: Drukhari/SacrificeToKhaineFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Traits/Drukhari/SacrificeToKhaineFlavor'/>

entry.name: Drukhari/ShadowfieldDescription
entry.value: Increases the invulnerable damage reduction. Goes on cooldown at the start of the next turn if damage is taken.

entry.name: Drukhari/ShadowfieldFlavor
entry.value: The shadow field surrounds its wearer in a dark miasma of energy that is almost impossible to penetrate. However, should a solid blow connect the field will short out, leaving its wearer vulnerable.

entry.name: Drukhari/SoulHarvest
entry.value: Soul Harvest

entry.name: Drukhari/SoulHarvestDescription
entry.value: Increases the damage of the target Drukhari allied unit and grants influence when this unit kills an enemy.

entry.name: Drukhari/SoulHarvestFlavor
entry.value: Few Drukhari leaders trust their underlings enough to allow them to gain power, knowing full well that the only rational use of power is to overthrow their oppressor. Despite this, occasionally a minion might be allowed off the leash, as long as its victories reflect entirely upon the Archon.

entry.name: Drukhari/SoulHungerLoyalty
entry.value: <string name='Traits/Drukhari/SoulHungerLoyalty'/>

entry.name: Drukhari/SoulHungerLoyaltyDescription
entry.value: Soul Hunger ability that increases the loyalty output of all Raider Fortresses.

entry.name: Drukhari/SoulHungerLoyaltyFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Traits/Drukhari/SoulHungerLoyaltyFlavor'/>

entry.name: Drukhari/SoulHungerOutposts
entry.value: <string name='Traits/Drukhari/SoulHungerOutposts'/>

entry.name: Drukhari/SoulHungerOutpostsDescription
entry.value: Soul Hunger ability that increases the resource output of controlled outposts.

entry.name: Drukhari/SoulHungerOutpostsFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Traits/Drukhari/SoulHungerOutpostsFlavor'/>

entry.name: Drukhari/FeastOfTorment
entry.value: <string name='Traits/Drukhari/FeastOfTorment'/>

entry.name: Drukhari/FeastOfTormentDescription
entry.value: Soul Hunger ability that grants all Drukhari units the ability to restore hitpoints each turn.

entry.name: Drukhari/FeastOfTormentFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Traits/Drukhari/FeastOfTormentFlavor'/>

entry.name: Drukhari/SoulShelling
entry.value: Webway Artillery

entry.name: Drukhari/SoulShellingDescription
entry.value: Soul Hunger ability that damages target enemy unit.

entry.name: Drukhari/SoulShellingFlavor
entry.value: The most powerful Drukhari weapons aren’t light enough to take on a Raid, instead reserved for the defense of the Kabal’s base in Comorroragh or on Battleships for realspace incursions—Phantom Lances and Scythe Missile Launchers and so on. But a wily Archon might allow his minions to fire one of these weapons through a temporary portal, knowing all the while the weapon might be turned on them…

entry.name: Drukhari/SpiritProbe
entry.value: Spirit Probe

entry.name: Drukhari/SpiritProbeDescription
entry.value: Grants additional feel no pain damage reduction to this unit and adjacent Drukhari infantry units at and above level 3.

entry.name: Drukhari/SpiritProbeFlavor
entry.value: A spirit probe is a conductor for agony; a device that ensures no scrap of pain or misery escapes the Cronos’ contra-empathic net. Running hot on tides of excruciation, it boosts the resilience of nearby Drukhari, allowing them to stride laughing amid volleys of fire and rains of blows that would otherwise tear them apart.

entry.name: Drukhari/SplinteredGenius
entry.value: Splintered Genius

entry.name: Drukhari/SplinteredGeniusDescription
entry.value: Grants an additional action point to this unit.

entry.name: Drukhari/SplinteredGeniusFlavor
entry.value: This Archon's usually calm exterior belies the truth of their debauched mind; that it is a battleground between extreme egos. Their violently sadistic side awaits only the right trigger—the fear, pain or weakness of others. Once unleashed, this Archon explodes into a killing fury, using their victims to slake their dark desires before regaining their regal composure.

entry.name: Drukhari/ToweringArrogance
entry.value: Towering Arrogance

entry.name: Drukhari/ToweringArroganceDescription
entry.value: Decreases the morale loss of allied Drukhari units in the area.

entry.name: Drukhari/ToweringArroganceFlavor
entry.value: A Haemonculus is possessed of the knowledge that his fleshcrafting skills make him effectively immortal so has nothing but scorn for the foe, no matter how horrifying their aspect. A Haemonculus and his coven will hold their place with a derisive sneer, regardless of the odds stacked against them, anticipating the pain and death to come.

entry.name: Drukhari/TwistedAnimator
entry.value: Twisted Animator

entry.name: Drukhari/TwistedAnimatorDescription
entry.value: Restores the hitpoints of an adjacent Wracks unit.

entry.name: Drukhari/TwistedAnimatorFlavor
entry.value: This deranged creature is an artist when it comes to the reshaping of flesh. A few deft slices—and a liberal application of horrifying unguents—allow ruptured skin to flow like wax and reform anew, the subject lurching back to life.

entry.name: Drukhari/WealthPlunder
entry.value: <string name='Traits/Drukhari/WealthPlunder'/>

entry.name: Drukhari/WealthPlunderDescription
entry.value: Soul Hunger ability that makes all Drukhari units grant research when killing enemies.

entry.name: Drukhari/WealthPlunderFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Traits/Drukhari/WealthPlunderFlavor'/>

entry.name: Drukhari/WebwayTravel
entry.value: <string name='Actions/Eldar/WebwayTravel'/>

entry.name: Drukhari/WebwayTravelDescription
entry.value: Travels from one allied Webway Gate, Raider Fortress or Web Portal to another.

entry.name: Drukhari/WebwayTravelFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Actions/Eldar/WebwayTravelFlavor'/>

entry.name: Drukhari/WhirlingDeath
entry.value: Whirling Death

entry.name: Drukhari/WhirlingDeathDescription
entry.value: Special attack that strikes all adjacent enemies.

entry.name: Drukhari/WhirlingDeathFlavor
entry.value: This murder-artist is constantly moving, their every acrobatic step accompanied by a lashing blade. They are at their most dangerous when the foe believes them surrounded, but this simply gives them more victims to practice their killing art upon.

entry.name: Eldar/ActivateWebwayGate
entry.value: Activate Webway Gate

entry.name: Eldar/ActivateWebwayGateDescription
entry.value: Activates and claims a neutral Webway Gate.

entry.name: Eldar/ActivateWebwayGateFlavor
entry.value: The Webway was once the backbone of the Aeldari empire—tunnels constructed through the warp in the time of the Old Ones that connected their golden core systems with the Maiden Worlds. Now those core systems are the Chaos-riddled Crone Worlds and the Webway is in pieces—but not on Gladius Prime…

entry.name: Eldar/AutarchsAssault
entry.value: Autarch's Assault

entry.name: Eldar/AutarchsAssaultDescription
entry.value: Kills with the Autarch increase the damage of allied Craftworld Aeldari units in the area.

entry.name: Eldar/AutarchsAssaultFlavor
entry.value: The Autarch is the master of warfare, having lived many lives in every Aeldari aspect shrine. Every one of his skilful attacks is both an inspiration to other Aeldari and a lesson in how to conduct war most effectively.

entry.name: Eldar/AsuryaniArrivals
entry.value: Asuryani Arrivals

entry.name: Eldar/AsuryaniArrivalsDescription
entry.value: Increases the growth rate.

entry.name: Eldar/AsuryaniArrivalsFlavor
entry.value: At a word from the commanding Farseer, a psychic missive is sent out through the Webway, to the craftworlds, exodite planets and roving Rangers, requesting support in this critical endeavour. Though the Aeldari race is dying, they will die fighting—and they come to Gladius to die there.

entry.name: Eldar/CommandDescription
entry.value: Increases the accuracy of allied Craftworld Aeldari units in the area.

entry.name: Eldar/CommandFlavor
entry.value: Autarchs walk the Path of Command, and even the Exarchs of the aspect shrines defer to them. An Autarch personally co-ordinates the fire of his army, with deft signals and comms, combining firepower and movement to lure enemies into ingenious death-traps.

entry.name: Eldar/CrystalTargetingMatrix
entry.value: Crystal Targeting Matrix

entry.name: Eldar/CrystalTargetingMatrixDescription
entry.value: Increases the accuracy.

entry.name: Eldar/CrystalTargetingMatrixFlavor
entry.value: Utilising advanced scanner technologies, this targeting matrix allows pinpoint fire even when on the move.

entry.name: Eldar/DestructorRenewer
entry.value: Renewer / Destructor

entry.name: Eldar/DestructorRenewerDescription
entry.value: Restores the hitpoints of target allied unit or damages target enemy unit.

entry.name: Eldar/DestructorRenewerFlavor
entry.value: Caging a portion of his psychic might, the Spiritseer sends waves of energy forth to destroy his enemies in a burst of azure flame--or, if the need arises, heal the wounds of his allies.

entry.name: Eldar/DoomDescription
entry.value: Increases the damage taken by target enemy unit.

entry.name: Eldar/DoomFlavor
entry.value: With a simple manipulation of that which is to come, the Farseer grants a darkened fate to a chosen foe. While this shadow rests upon the enemy’s soul, death seeks them out above all others, each blow or shot that comes their way rendered inescapably lethal.

entry.name: Eldar/EmboldenHorrify
entry.value: Embolden / Horrify

entry.name: Eldar/EmboldenHorrifyDescription
entry.value: Restores the morale of target allied unit or decreases the morale of target enemy unit.

entry.name: Eldar/EmboldenHorrifyFlavor
entry.value: The Spiritseer calls down the splendour of battle, instilling his allies with valour or sapping courage from his foes.

entry.name: Eldar/KhaineAwakened
entry.value: Khaine Awakened

entry.name: Eldar/KhaineAwakenedDescription
entry.value: Increases the melee attacks and melee damage, decreases the morale loss and grants immunity to fear and pinning to adjacent friendly Aeldari units.

entry.name: Eldar/KhaineAwakenedFlavor
entry.value: As the Wailing Doom cries out for blood and the Avatar rouses itself for war, so too are nearby Aeldari driven to greater deeds in his name. Fearing nothing, they throw themselves into the melee battle-crazed.

entry.name: Eldar/KhainesMight
entry.value: Khaine's Might

entry.name: Eldar/KhainesMightDescription
entry.value: Increases the melee attacks of the Autarch.

entry.name: Eldar/KhainesMightFlavor
entry.value: An Autarch has mastery of all the Exarch shrines and has learned something from them all. Few mortal creatures can stand against the skill of an Autarch when fully unleashed.

entry.name: Eldar/LinkedFire
entry.value: Linked Fire

entry.name: Eldar/LinkedFireDescription
entry.value: Increases the damage and armor penetration of target allied Fire Prism’s Prism Cannon.

entry.name: Eldar/LinkedFireFlavor
entry.value: The unusual design of a Fire Prism’s Prism Cannon crystal is designed to allow it to further concentrate its already-intense beam by feeding it into another Fire Prism, focusing both machine’s firepower into a single shot.

entry.name: Eldar/MindWar
entry.value: Mind War

entry.name: Eldar/MindWarDescription
entry.value: Reduces the accuracy of target enemy unit. Deals damage based on the difference in morale between the Farseer Skyrunner and the target unit.

entry.name: Eldar/MindWarFlavor
entry.value: The Farseer reaches out to attack the mind of an enemy in a desperate mental duel. Foes find their thoughts invaded by the crushing presence of the Farseer, his ancient and inscrutable will extinguishing their personality with horrific ease, triggering a cascade of psychosomatic trauma.

entry.name: Eldar/ProtectJinx
entry.value: Protect / Jinx

entry.name: Eldar/ProtectJinxDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour of target allied unit or decreases the armour of target enemy unit.

entry.name: Eldar/ProtectJinxFlavor
entry.value: Chained by runes of power, fate itself is bound to the Spiritseer’s will.

entry.name: Eldar/ReturnOfTheAeldari
entry.value: Return of the Aeldari

entry.name: Eldar/ReturnOfTheAeldariDescription
entry.value: Increases the flat amount of resources gained from outposts.

entry.name: Eldar/ReturnOfTheAeldariFlavor
entry.value: After the disappearance of the Old Ones, the Aeldari ruled this planet for millions of years. They understand better than anyone else how to best cultivate and access its unique resources.

entry.name: Eldar/SpiritMark
entry.value: Spirit Mark

entry.name: Eldar/SpiritMarkDescription
entry.value: Increases the accuracy of allied Wraithblades, Wraithknights and Wraithlords.

entry.name: Eldar/SpiritMarkFlavor
entry.value: The Avatar’s presence invigorates the dead distinctly from the living. Whilst the latter are filled with Khaine’s incandescent rage, those machines manned by spirit crystals instead find their awareness raised from their usual somnambulance, enabling them to better focus on their targets.

entry.name: Eldar/TranscendentBliss
entry.value: Transcendent Bliss

entry.name: Eldar/TranscendentBlissDescription
entry.value: Increases the loyalty.

entry.name: Eldar/TranscendentBlissFlavor
entry.value: The life of an Aeldari is infinitely richer than that of a human, given their tremendous sensitivity, intellect and intensity of feeling—and sometimes it takes shared moments of that bliss to remind the Aeldari what they’re fighting for in this dark universe.

entry.name: Eldar/VectorDancer
entry.value: Vector Dancer

entry.name: Eldar/VectorDancerDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour against ranged attacks.

entry.name: Eldar/VectorDancerFlavor
entry.value: Some aircraft are crafted with an eye towards manoeuvrability.

entry.name: Eldar/VectoredEngines
entry.value: Vectored Engines

entry.name: Eldar/VectoredEnginesDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour against ranged attacks.

entry.name: Eldar/VectoredEnginesFlavor
entry.value: Vectored engines allow the pilot of an Aeldari vehicle to rapidly alter its facing, placing deadly weapons, or stronger armour, to the fore. Often, this can mean the difference between sustaining critical damage and taking an indirect blow that can soon be shrugged off.

entry.name: Eldar/WarShout
entry.value: War Shout

entry.name: Eldar/WarShoutDescription
entry.value: Reduces the morale of adjacent enemy units.

entry.name: Eldar/WarShoutFlavor
entry.value: In Aeldari mythology, banshees foreshadow the death of warriors with their howl. The Howling Banshee aspect warriors wear a specialised mask that amplifies and weaponises their thoughts into psychic screams. Whilst their foes are stunned, the Banshees close, power swords at the ready…

entry.name: Eldar/WebwayRedoubt
entry.value: Found Webway Redoubt

entry.name: Eldar/WebwayRedoubtDescription
entry.value:
Founds city on a claimed Webway Gate.

Cities can only be found where there are no other cities within a %1% tile radius. Each city after the first decreases loyalty in all cities by %2%.

entry.name: Eldar/WebwayRedoubtFlavor
entry.value: To preserve the ancient Webway gates on Gladius, the Aeldari know that they must protect them. These rapidly-constructed Redoubts provide some defenses, drawing on the Webway’s limitless power to devastate any enemies foolish enough to venture near.

entry.name: Eldar/WebwayTravel
entry.value: Webway Travel

entry.name: Eldar/WebwayTravelDescription
entry.value: Travels from one allied Webway Gate or Webway Redoubt to another.

entry.name: Eldar/WebwayTravelFlavor
entry.value: The unique Webway sub-structure riddling Gladius Prime enables the Aeldari and Drukhari to travel rapidly between the gateways dotted across the planet—though now that they are active, wise opposing races will recognise their threat and eliminate them on first sight.

entry.name: Eldar/WillOfAsuryan
entry.value: Will of Asuryan

entry.name: Eldar/WillOfAsuryanDescription
entry.value: Restores the morale of allied units in the area.

entry.name: Eldar/WillOfAsuryanFlavor
entry.value: The leader of the Aeldari Gods, Asuryan provided guidance to the growing Aeldari race before his consumption by Slaanesh. The Farseers of Gladius can draw upon his might to bolster their forces, inspiring them to fight on.

entry.name: EnfeebleDescription
entry.value: Reduces the damage and movement of the target enemy unit.

entry.name: EnfeebleFlavor
entry.value: As the psyker channels his powers, tendrils of Warp energy lash over his victims, every caress sapping strength and vitality from their bodies.

entry.name: EnslavementDescription
entry.value: Takes control of the target enemy weakminded unit until the enslaving unit dies.

entry.name: EreWeGo
entry.value: 'Ere We Go!

entry.name: EreWeGoDescription
entry.value: Increases the movement.

entry.name: EreWeGoFlavor
entry.value: Ever eager to get stuck into the fray, Orks will barrel across the battlefield as quick as they can when the foe is in their sights.

entry.name: FoundCity
entry.value: Found City

entry.name: FoundCityDescription
entry.value:
Consumes the unit to found a new city.

Cities can only be found where there are no other cities within a %1% tile radius. Each city after the first decreases loyalty in all cities by %2%.

entry.name: FoundCityNecrons
entry.value: Found City (Necrons)

entry.name: FoundCityNecronsDescription
entry.value:
Consumes the unit to found a new city.

Necron cities can only be found on top of Necron Tombs and if there are no other cities within a 4 tile radius. Each city after the first decreases loyalty in all cities by 6.

entry.name: FullThrottle
entry.value: “Full Throttle!”

entry.name: FullThrottleDescription
entry.value: Grants movement to the Tank Commander and adjacent allied tanks with movement remaining.

entry.name: FullThrottleFlavor
entry.value: The officer leads a glorious tank charge that grinds the enemy beneath his treads.

entry.name: GateOfInfinity
entry.value: Gate of Infinity

entry.name: GateOfInfinityDescription
entry.value: Teleports to target explored tile.

entry.name: GateOfInfinityFlavor
entry.value: The psyker punches a corridor through the roiling Immaterium, allowing him to cross great distances in the blink of an eye.

entry.name: GrabbinKlaw
entry.value: Grabbin' Klaw

entry.name: GrabbinKlawDescription
entry.value: Immobilizes the target enemy ground vehicle unit.

entry.name: GrabbinKlawFlavor
entry.value: In their pursuit of ever-larger Power Klaws, Ork Meks occasionally make ones that are simply too large for even the most over-sized Boss or Deff Dread. These are mounted on vehicles, where they are used to immobilise enemy vehicles or perform outrageous handbrake turns.

entry.name: GunnersKillOnSight
entry.value: “Gunners, Kill on Sight!”

entry.name: GunnersKillOnSightDescription
entry.value: Increases the ranged attacks of the Tank Commander and adjacent allied tanks.

entry.name: GunnersKillOnSightFlavor
entry.value: The officer gives his men free rein to unleash discretionary fire.

entry.name: HallucinationDescription
entry.value: Decreases the attacks of target enemy unit.

entry.name: HallucinationFlavor
entry.value: Paranoia, confusion and panic are heightened to a debilitating degree as the telepath alters his foes’ perceptions.

entry.name: HammerOfWrath
entry.value: Hammer of Wrath

entry.name: HammerOfWrathDescription
entry.value: Increases the damage of non-Bomb weapons.

entry.name: HammerOfWrathFlavor
entry.value: Many warriors hurl themselves headlong into combat, seeking to crush or trample the foe.

entry.name: HammerhandDescription
entry.value: Increases melee damage

entry.name: HammerhandFlavor
entry.value: Focussing the raging power of his mind, the psyker augments the strength of his comrades to the point where they can crush flesh and bone with a single blow.

entry.name: Heal
entry.value: Hold Position Until Healed

entry.name: HealDescription
entry.value: Holds position until fully healed.

entry.name: HealingSurge
entry.value: Healing Surge

entry.name: HealingSurgeDescription
entry.value: Restores the hitpoints.

entry.name: HealingSurgeFlavor
entry.value:
“I haven't lost an arm, brother. It's right over there.”
— Captain Alessio Cortez, Crimson Fists

entry.name: HoldFire
entry.value: Hold Fire

entry.name: HoldFireDescription
entry.value: Prevents retaliation when attacked.

entry.name: HoldPosition
entry.value: Hold Position

entry.name: HoldPositionDescription
entry.value: Holds position until engaged by an enemy unit.

entry.name: IronWill
entry.value: Iron Will

entry.name: IronWillDescription
entry.value: After dying, the Lord Commissar immediately comes back to life.

entry.name: IronWillFlavor
entry.value:
“Pain is temporary, Honour is forever.”
— Colonel-Commissar Ibram Gaunt, Tanith First and Only

entry.name: JinkDescription
entry.value: Increases the ranged damage reduction but reduces the accuracy. Cannot be used if the unit has attacked this turn.

entry.name: JinkFlavor
