entry.value: Some units favour speed and agility rather than heavy armour to keep them alive on the battlefield, dodging and weaving unscathed through hails of incoming fire.

entry.name: JumpPack
entry.value: Jump Pack

entry.name: JumpPackDescription
entry.value: Flies across obstacles to the target tile.

entry.name: JumpPackFlavor
entry.value: A jump pack enables the wearer to make bounding leaps across the battlefield and make boosted flights over short distances or to the tops of fortress walls.

entry.name: LevelUp
entry.value: Level Up

entry.name: LevitateDescription
entry.value: Flies across obstacles to the target tile.

entry.name: LevitateFlavor
entry.value: The psyker uses his telekinetic powers to launch himself skywards, leaping across the battlefield in a single bound.

entry.name: MachineEmpathy
entry.value: Deploy Machine Empathy

entry.name: MachineEmpathyDescription
entry.value: Chapter tactic that restores the hitpoints of vehicle and fortification units.

entry.name: MachineEmpathyFlavor
entry.value:
“Consider the Predator. Let your soul be armoured with Faith, driven on the tracks of obedience which overcomes all obstacles, and armed with the three great guns of Zeal, Duty and Purity.”
— Traditional Imperial prayer, source unknown

entry.name: MediPackDescription
entry.value: Restores the hitpoints.

entry.name: MediPackFlavor
entry.value: Medi-packs contain all the necessary drugs, dressings and surgical tools to get a wounded Imperial Guardsman back in the fight, or save the lives of vital personnel.

entry.name: MeksTools
entry.value: Mek's Tools

entry.name: MeksToolsDescription
entry.value: Restores the hitpoints of the target allied vehicle or fortification unit.

entry.name: MeksToolsFlavor
entry.value:
“Yer arm? I don't care about yer arm! Me trukk's zogging ruined! Did no wun tell you to stay away from Laskannons? 'Ere, Grot. Pass me the wotsit, the thingummy, and the whacker. And the red paint, o' course. She'll be all shiny-new in no time.”
— Skinwab, Evil Sunz Mek

entry.name: MindControl
entry.value: Mind Control

entry.name: MindControlDescription
entry.value: Reduces the morale of adjacent enemy units each turn.

entry.name: MisfortuneDescription
entry.value: Increases the damage taken for the target enemy unit.

entry.name: MisfortuneFlavor
entry.value: With a click of his fingers, the diviner twists fate so that his followers' blows punch through the weakest points in their opponent's armour.

entry.name: NartheciumDescription
entry.value: Restores the hitpoints of the target allied infantry or monstrous creature unit.

entry.name: NartheciumFlavor
entry.value: The narthecium is used by Space Marine Apothecaries to dispense medical aid, including complex battlefield surgery, to the wounded. The wrist-mounted device also houses a reductor—the mechanism with which the gene-seed of the fallen is recovered, ensuring the Chapter's future.

entry.name: Necrons/BloodyCrusade
entry.value: Bloody Crusade

entry.name: Necrons/BloodyCrusadeDescription
entry.value: Increases the attacks.

entry.name: Necrons/BloodyCrusadeFlavor
entry.value: In its desire to rid the universe of organic life, a Destroyer Lord can descend into a savage insanity, raining blow after blow on its opponents, far beyond safe protocols.

entry.name: Necrons/ChronometronDescription
entry.value: Increases damage reduction of the target allied unit.

entry.name: Necrons/ChronometronFlavor
entry.value: These eye-shaped devices project a bubble of energy that can alter the flow of time itself, slowing incoming projectiles such that those nearby can simply move out of their path.

entry.name: Necrons/DefensiveProtocols
entry.value: Defensive Protocols

entry.name: Necrons/DefensiveProtocolsDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour of the Lord and allied Necron units in range.

entry.name: Necrons/DefensiveProtocolsFlavor
entry.value: A Necron’s Lords higher functions aren’t devoted to containing a more-charming personality or a fiercer intelligence—they also contain control protocols that enable them to coordinate nearby Necron troops more minutely, heavily increasing their chances of survival.

entry.name: Necrons/DestructionProtocols
entry.value: Destruction Protocols

entry.name: Necrons/DestructionProtocolsDescription
entry.value: Increases the damage taken for adjacent enemy units.

entry.name: Necrons/DestructionProtocolsFlavor
entry.value: When a Necron Lord falls to the Destroyer curse, they abandon the caution and of their Defensive Protocols, reconfiguring their engrammic pathways to augment the aggression of their peers, not their defensive capabilities.

entry.name: Necrons/DimensionalCorridor
entry.value: Dimensional Corridor

entry.name: Necrons/DimensionalCorridorDescription
entry.value: Teleports to a tile adjacent to a city or Monolith.

entry.name: Necrons/DimensionalCorridorFlavor
entry.value:
“And first to walk the starlight bridge, from incorporeal to corporeal, was Artemorra, to whom the Necrontyr gave the name 'Messenger', later changed to 'Deceiver'—with good reason.”
— Fragmentary inscription on a Jokaerian Defence Orb

entry.name: Necrons/DynastyDescription
entry.value: Increases the population limit of cities.

entry.name: Necrons/DynastyFlavor
entry.value: It’s a truism that the greatest leaders attract the largest numbers of followers—or in the case of the Necrons, the greatest leaders have wider security permissions over their Canoptek maintenance units, enabling a higher population density in a given location.

entry.name: Necrons/FabricatorClawArray
entry.value: Fabricator Claw Array

entry.name: Necrons/FabricatorClawArrayDescription
entry.value: Restores the hitpoints of the target allied vehicle or fortification unit.

entry.name: Necrons/FabricatorClawArrayFlavor
entry.value: This clicking, whirring proliferation of energy tools is primarily intended for maintenance and repair.

entry.name: Necrons/GloomPrism
entry.value: Gloom Prism

entry.name: Necrons/GloomPrismDescription
entry.value: Increases the witchfire damage reduction of the Canoptek Spyder and adjacent allied units.

entry.name: Necrons/GloomPrismFlavor
entry.value: The gloom prism's energy field creates a zone shrouded from Warp-spawned powers.

entry.name: Necrons/GravityPulse
entry.value: Gravity Pulse

entry.name: Necrons/GravityPulseDescription
entry.value: Reduces the movement of and deals damage to adjacent enemy flyer, skimmer and jetbike units.

entry.name: Necrons/HuntersFromHyperspace
entry.value: Hunters from Hyperspace

entry.name: Necrons/HuntersFromHyperspaceDescription
entry.value: Teleports to target explored tile and increases damage.

entry.name: Necrons/HuntersFromHyperspaceFlavor
entry.value: These deadly marksmen seldom take position with the rest of the army. Instead, they slip sideways out of reality and monitor the conflict from a hyperspace oubliette – a pocket dimension riding the gap between the then and now. The Deathmarks track enemy communication channels, teleport beams and orbital descents in order to select suitably high-profile prey. This done, they exit their oubliette to tag their quarry with the hunter’s mark from which they take their name – an eerie green energy halo that plays about the target’s head in five dimensions.

entry.name: Necrons/JetCharge
entry.value: Jet Charge

entry.name: Necrons/JetChargeDescription
entry.value: Increases damage reduction and flies across obstacles to the target tile.

entry.name: Necrons/JetChargeFlavor
entry.value: In its limitless rage, a headstrong Necron Destroyer Lord can overcharge its grav-platform to move short distances extremely quickly, albeit at a further cost to its reason.

entry.name: Necrons/MindshackleScarabs
entry.value: Mindshackle Scarabs

entry.name: Necrons/MindshackleScarabsDescription
entry.value: Reduces the morale of the target fearful enemy unit.

entry.name: Necrons/MindshackleScarabsFlavor
entry.value: At the bearer's command, tiny mindshackle scarabs burrow into their target's brain, bypassing cerebral functions and robbing the unfortunate victim of their wits.

entry.name: Necrons/NecrodermisRepair
entry.value: Necrodermis Repair

entry.name: Necrons/NecrodermisRepairDescription
entry.value: Restores the hitpoints.

entry.name: Necrons/NecrodermisRepairFlavor
entry.value: If a Necron is only mildly damaged, their living metal body can somewhat heal itself, flowing reserve metals to cover flaws and failings.

entry.name: Necrons/PhaseShiftGenerator
entry.value: Phase Shift Generator

entry.name: Necrons/PhaseShiftGeneratorDescription
entry.value: Increases the invulnerable damage reduction of the Gauss Pylon and adjacent allied Necron units.

entry.name: Necrons/PhaseShiftGeneratorFlavor
entry.value: When a Gauss Pylon is raised from the ground, it creates a temporal bubble altering the local flow of space time. Nearby Necrons can take advantage of this, shifting out of phase with reality to avoid destruction.

entry.name: Necrons/QuantumShielding
entry.value: Quantum Shielding

entry.name: Necrons/QuantumShieldingDescription
entry.value: Increases the invulnerable damage reduction. Goes on cooldown at the start of the next turn if damage is taken.

entry.name: Necrons/QuantumShieldingFlavor
entry.value: Necron quantum shielding is a marvel of science, existing only at the precise moment of deflection—at all other times there is no indication of its presence. They are, however, temperamental devices, prone to malfunction if overloaded.

entry.name: Necrons/RepairBarge
entry.value: Repair Barge

entry.name: Necrons/RepairBargeDescription
entry.value: Restores the hitpoints of the target allied Necron infantry or monstrous creature unit.

entry.name: Necrons/RepairBargeFlavor
entry.value: Stately they might be, but these sinister vehicles are as great a threat as the better-known Monolith. Their role is to support the Necron army, gliding across the battlefield and disgorging minute repair scarabs to return even the most devastated Necron warriors to battle readiness, before transporting them back to the fray.

entry.name: Necrons/RapidRise
entry.value: Rapid Rise

entry.name: Necrons/RapidRiseDescription
entry.value: Rushes current production.

entry.name: Necrons/RapidRiseFlavor
entry.value: In times of desperation, a Necron Lord can override safety protocols in the reanimation of troops or repair of vehicles, at the cost of heavily increased losses. He will, however, lose support amongst any those of the ruling class who retain sentience, in horror at the waste of resources.

entry.name: Necrons/ReaperDescription
entry.value: Increases the armour and accuracy. Jet Charge recharges when the Destroyer Lord gains experience from combat.

entry.name: Necrons/ReaperFlavor
entry.value: Where the Flayers suffer the deathcurse of Llandu'gor, the Destroyers' madness derives from the universal fate of all Necrons—the loss of their souls when they took on living metal bodies. In the Destroyers, this drives them to refine themselves more and more, to become closer to perfect weapons—curiously, thus, closer to Aza'gorod, the Nightbringer, the doom of all life.

entry.name: Necrons/ResurrectionOrb
entry.value: Resurrection Orb

entry.name: Necrons/ResurrectionOrbDescription
entry.value: Restores the hitpoints of the target allied unit.

entry.name: Necrons/ResurrectionOrbFlavor
entry.value: This glowing sphere focuses energy into the regeneration circuits of nearby Necrons, enhancing their ability to self-repair.

entry.name: Necrons/RoyalGuard
entry.value: Royal Guard

entry.name: Necrons/RoyalGuardDescription
entry.value: Summon temporary Triarch Praetorians.

entry.name: Necrons/RoyalGuardFlavor
entry.value:
“I have watched the galaxy for sixty million years. I have raised civilisations to our ways and seen them thrive, fade and pass into myth. And I still believe that to exist without honour, without laws—well, it is better not to exist at all.”
— Eystan, Triarch Praetorian

entry.name: Necrons/ScarabHive
entry.value: Scarab Hive

entry.name: Necrons/ScarabHiveDescription
entry.value: Summons Canoptek Scarabs.

entry.name: Necrons/ScarabHiveFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Units/Necrons/CanoptekScarabFlavor'/>

entry.name: Necrons/SleepingSentry
entry.value: Sleeping Sentry

entry.name: Necrons/SleepingSentryDescription
entry.value: Increases damage reduction but prevents acting.

entry.name: Necrons/SolarPulse
entry.value: Solar Pulse

entry.name: Necrons/SolarPulseDescription
entry.value: Reduces the accuracy of enemy infantry and monstrous creature units in the area.

entry.name: Necrons/SolarPulseFlavor
entry.value: The Solar Staff burns with the light of truth and honour, and when its powers are unleashed they are a bane to all shadows. Set loose, the staff's energies blaze outward in a mighty flare, as though a new sun was born. The darkness is driven back by this false dawn, and the foe reels as their eyes are blinded and their deceptions are laid bare.

entry.name: Necrons/TheBoundCoalescent
entry.value: The Bound Coalescent

entry.name: Necrons/TheBoundCoalescentDescription
entry.value: Merges with an Obelisk to create a Tesseract Vault.

entry.name: Necrons/TheBoundCoalescentFlavor
entry.value: The C'tan were immeasurably-powerful and wholly evil; these shards, fragmented by the Necrons' desperate conspiracy, are all that remains of them. In desperate times, two shards might be allowed to re-coalesce, to form a greater weapon—but the Necrons never forget the insane power of the originals.

entry.name: Necrons/VoidStrike
entry.value: Void Strike

entry.name: Necrons/VoidStrikeDescription
entry.value: Performs a Voidblade attack with increased attacks.

entry.name: Necrons/VoidStrikeFlavor
entry.value:
“The best weapon is the one that you never have to use.”
— Kanaa the Tranquil, Necron Cryptek, creator of the Void Strike

entry.name: Necrons/WrithingWorldscape
entry.value: Writhing Worldscape

entry.name: Necrons/WrithingWorldscapeDescription
entry.value: Reduces the movement of adjacent enemy units.

entry.name: ObjurationMechanicum
entry.value: Objuration Mechanicum

entry.name: ObjurationMechanicumDescription
entry.value: Curses the ranged weaponry of the target enemy unit. Also deals damage if the target is a vehicle or a fortification.

entry.name: ObjurationMechanicumFlavor
entry.value: Weapons jam and engines seize up as the telekine uses his powers to wrench and twist the inner workings at the hearts of nearby machines.

entry.name: OrationOfRestoration
entry.value: Oration of Restoration

entry.name: OrationOfRestorationDescription
entry.value: Restores the hitpoints of the Chaplain and adjacent allied units each turn.

entry.name: OrationOfRestorationFlavor
entry.value:
“At battle's end, speak the Liturgy in a clear voice. Respect the bravery of the living. Give the Rite of Passage to the fallen. Honour the battle gear of the dead. To do all this with reverence, even when exhausted by battle and weary from the field, is the duty of a Chaplain. It is his burden and satisfaction.”
— Adeptus Astartes, The Book of Faith

entry.name: OrbitalBombardment
entry.value: Orbital Strike

entry.name: OrbitalBombardmentDescription
entry.value: Operation that bombards the target enemy unit.

entry.name: OrbitalBombardmentFlavor
entry.value:
“No Exterminatus Extremis order is carried out lightly. To order the death of a planet by Virus Bomb, Cyclonic Torpedo or Atmospheric Incinerator, one must be certain of one's intent. One must accept that millions, even billions, will die so that the rest of humanity may live.”
— Lord High Admiral Soheil, at the scouring of Colchis

entry.name: OrbitalDeployment
entry.value: Orbital Deployment

entry.name: OrbitalDeploymentDescription
entry.value: Deploys the unit from a city tile to the target tile.

entry.name: OrbitalDeploymentFlavor
entry.value: Some units make their way to battle via tunnelling, teleportation, flying or some other extraordinary means which allows them to appear in the thick of the fighting.

entry.name: OrbitalScan
entry.value: Orbital Scan

entry.name: OrbitalScanDescription
entry.value: Operation that reveals the target tile and adjacent tiles.

entry.name: OrbitalScanFlavor
entry.value: A Space Marine Chapter commonly possesses an entire fleet of ships, ranging from tiny Thunderhawk Gunships to massive Strike Cruisers. On Gladius Prime, the Chapter fleet was decimated by the warp storm. Only one ship survives, swinging around the planet in a low, erratic orbit. Yet for sufficiently important targets, the Techmarine and Servitor crew will focus all its sensors onto the planet's surface.

entry.name: OrbitalStrike
entry.value: Orbital Strike

entry.name: OrbitalStrikeDescription
entry.value: Calls down an orbital strike upon the target enemy unit.

entry.name: Orks/BigBoss
entry.value: Big Boss

entry.name: Orks/BigBossDescription
entry.value: Increases the maximum hitpoints.

entry.name: Orks/BigBossFlavor
entry.value:
“Da bigger I iz, the 'arder I 'it.”
— Da Rok, Ork Nob

entry.name: Orks/BustHeads
entry.value: Bust Heads

entry.name: Orks/BustHeadsDescription
entry.value: Reduces the morale loss for the Warboss and nearby allied units.

entry.name: Orks/BustHeadsFlavor
entry.value:
“Oi, you zogging berks! Stop 'itting each uvver and start 'itting the beakies! Or do I have to start 'itting… you? I ain't askin'—I's tellin'. Geddit?”
— Da Rok, Ork Nob

entry.name: Orks/ChannelMentalEmissions
entry.value: Channel Mental Emissions

entry.name: Orks/ChannelMentalEmissionsDescription
entry.value: Increases the research output of the clan.

entry.name: Orks/ChannelMentalEmissionsFlavor
entry.value:
“The Orks are the pinnacle of creation. For them, the great struggle is won. They have evolved a society which knows no stress or angst. Who are we to judge them? We Aeldari who have failed, or the Humans, on the road to ruin in their turn? And why? Because we sought answers to questions that an Ork wouldn't even bother to ask! We see a culture that is strong and despise it as crude.”
— Uthan the Perverse, Aeldari Philosopher

entry.name: Orks/CyborkImplants
entry.value: Cybork Implants

entry.name: Orks/CyborkImplantsDescription
entry.value: Permanently increases the damage and damage reduction of the target allied infantry or monstrous creature unit.

entry.name: Orks/CyborkImplantsFlavor
entry.value:
“Exhibit 40: Ork skin sample. This was from a senior individual in the Orkoid hierarchy, as can be seen from the increased thickness of bone, muscle and ablative skin, and the reduction in nerve structures. The laser grid is there to prevent it attempting to regrow the entire Ork.“
— Lecture transcripts, Grigomen “Orklover” Delr, Rogue Trader and amateur Xenologist

entry.name: Orks/DaJump
entry.value: Da Jump

entry.name: Orks/DaJumpDescription
entry.value: Teleports the Weirdboy and adjacent allied units to the target tile and adjacent tiles.

entry.name: Orks/DaJumpFlavor
entry.value: The Weirdboy closes his eyes tight and, in a storm of flashing green light, teleports himself to another part of the battlefield—along with any confused Boyz who happened to be standing too close to him at the time.

entry.name: Orks/DoksTools
entry.value: Dok's Tools

entry.name: Orks/DoksToolsDescription
entry.value: Restores the hitpoints of the target allied infantry unit or monstrous creature unit.

entry.name: Orks/DoksToolsFlavor
entry.value: From chain-scalpels and cranial trowels to a nicely weighted mallet, Ork surgical implements are crude yet surprisingly effective.

entry.name: Orks/ExperimentalProcedure
entry.value: Experimental Procedure

entry.name: Orks/ExperimentalProcedureDescription
entry.value: Increases the damage and damage reduction of the target allied infantry or monstrous creature unit.

entry.name: Orks/ExperimentalProcedureFlavor
entry.value:
“Exhibit 12: Ork biomechanical modification. 'Cyborks' are modified with equipment like this by the species' innate specialists, the 'Oddboyz', to repair major injuries and/or augment their capabilities. This one resembles an Imperial power weapon, save for the large claws and maker's mark which reads 'Grillmek woz 'ere!'“
— Lecture transcripts, Grigomen “Orklover” Delr, Rogue Trader and amateur Xenologist

entry.name: Orks/ExtraBitz
entry.value: Extra Bitz

entry.name: Orks/ExtraBitzDescription
entry.value: Reduces the food, ore and energy upkeep of infantry units and monstrous creature units in the region.

entry.name: Orks/KustomForceField
entry.value: Kustom Force Field

entry.name: Orks/KustomForceFieldDescription
entry.value: Increases the ranged damage reduction of this unit and adjacent allied units.

entry.name: Orks/KustomForceFieldFlavor
entry.value: These bizarre devices are powered by crackling energy-coils and project invisible bubbles of energy that shield nearby Orks from incoming fire.

entry.name: Orks/ProphetOfTheWaaagh
entry.value: Prophet of the Waaagh!

entry.name: Orks/ProphetOfTheWaaaghDescription
entry.value: Increase the influence gain when dealing damage for units with Might Makes Right in the region.

entry.name: Orks/ProphetOfTheWaaaghFlavor
entry.value:
“I'm da hand of Gork and Mork, dey sent me to rouse up da boyz to crush and kill 'cos da boyz forgot what dere 'ere for… I'm da profit of da Waaagh an' whole worlds burn in my boot prints. I'm Warlord Ghazghkull Mag Uruk Thraka an' I speak wiv da word of da gods.”
— Ghazghkull Mag Uruk Thraka, Ork Warlord

entry.name: Orks/WarbikeTurboBoost
entry.value: Warbike Turbo-Boost

entry.name: Orks/WarbikeTurboBoostDescription
entry.value: Increases the movement and ranged damage reduction.

entry.name: Orks/WarbikeTurboBoostFlavor
entry.value:
“‘Fasta, fasta! Dey can’t ‘it wot dey can’t sees! Smack all dem turbos!”
— Last words of Da Rok, Ork Nob and erstwhile warbiker

entry.name: Orks/WarpathDescription
entry.value: Increases the number of melee attacks of the Weirdboy and adjacent Mob Rule allied units.

entry.name: Orks/WarpathFlavor
entry.value: The Weirdboy disperses the Waaagh! energy coursing through his frame into the Ork warriors around him, stirring their already bellicose, warlike nature to roaring fever pitch.

entry.name: OverwatchDescription
entry.value: Attacks enemy units that enter the attack range.

entry.name: PowerOfTheMachineSpirit
entry.value: Power of the Machine Spirit

entry.name: PowerOfTheMachineSpiritDescription
entry.value: Increases the ranged accuracy.

entry.name: PowerOfTheMachineSpiritFlavor
entry.value: The interface between this vehicle's advanced machine spirit and its fire control mechanisms allows the crew to target foes with incredible accuracy.

entry.name: PowerStrike
entry.value: Power Strike

entry.name: PowerStrikeDescription
entry.value: Performs a Power Sword attack with increased damage.

entry.name: PowerStrikeFlavor
entry.value:
“My sword is at the Emperor's command. I answer to no other man, living or dead.”
— Tu'shan, Chapter Master of the Salamanders

entry.name: ProduceUnit
entry.value: Produce %1%

entry.name: ProduceUnitHint
RazeBuilding
entry.value: Raze Building

entry.name: RazeBuildingDescription
entry.value: Raze target building.

entry.name: RepairDescription
entry.value: Restores the hitpoints of the target allied vehicle, fortification or T'au unit.

entry.name: RepairFlavor
entry.value: For the Tyranids, it may be a slick of healing enzymes and symbiotes. For the Orks, a welding torch and WAAAGH! Power. For the T’au, hard advanced science. But every race has some capability for fixing the damage caused by combat and by the hostile world of Gladius Prime.

entry.name: ReturnToTheShadows
entry.value: Return to the Shadows

entry.name: ReturnToTheShadowsDescription
entry.value: Increases damage reduction.

entry.name: ReturnToTheShadowsFlavor
entry.value: Those kissed by the void find it easy to melt away into the shadows once their bloody ambush has been launched.

entry.name: RitesOfWar
entry.value: Rites of War

entry.name: RitesOfWarDescription
entry.value: Increases the damage of the Chaplain and adjacent allied units.

entry.name: RitesOfWarFlavor
entry.value: Honour-bound by sacred oaths of fealty to the Imperium, the Chaplain and his warriors vow before the Chapter and the Emperor to secure victory at any cost.

entry.name: RollOverThem
entry.value: “Roll Over Them!”

entry.name: RollOverThemDescription
entry.value: Rolls over target enemy infantry.

entry.name: RollOverThemFlavor
entry.value: When all else fails, gravity and the immense weight of a vehicle can crush otherwise impenetrable defenses—or stalwart opponents.

entry.name: SciersGaze
entry.value: Scrier's Gaze

entry.name: SciersGazeDescription
entry.value: Reveals the target tile and adjacent tiles.

entry.name: SciersGazeFlavor
entry.value: The diviner can see the battlefield clearly in the mind's eye, with the vantage point of a hunting hawk and the precision of a laser. The to and fro of armies and war machines is but the scurrying of ants beneath his omniscient gaze. Thus can the diviner direct the deployment of specialist forces exactly when and where they are most needed, directing them to vital objectives that, once secured, will ensure victory.

entry.name: ScoutDescription
entry.value: Reveals all tiles in the area.

entry.name: SellHint
SetRallyPoint
entry.value: Set Rally Point

entry.name: SetRallyPointDescription
entry.value: Sets the rally point for newly produced units in this city.

entry.name: Shockwave
entry.value: <string name='Weapons/Shockwave'/>

entry.name: ShockwaveFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Weapons/ShockwaveFlavor'/>

entry.name: ShopDescription
entry.value: Buys and sells items for influence. Available at the Jokaero Trader Encampment.

entry.name: ShroudingDescription
entry.value: Increases the ranged damage reduction of this unit and adjacent allied units.

entry.name: ShroudingFlavor
entry.value: The psyker uses his mastery of the Warp to fog the minds of his enemies, clouding their sight and instincts so that he appears as nothing more than an indistinct shadow.

entry.name: SiegeMasters
entry.value: Deploy Siege Masters

entry.name: SiegeMastersDescription
entry.value: Chapter tactic that increases the damage of units attacking enemy units in cities and fortifications.

entry.name: SiegeMastersFlavor
entry.value:
“A fortress circumvented ceases to be an obstacle. A fortress destroyed ceases to be a threat. Do not forget the difference.”
— Leman Russ, Primarch of the Space Wolves

entry.name: SignumDescription
entry.value: <string name='Traits/RelentlessDescription'/>

entry.name: SignumFlavor
entry.value: The signum is a communication device that quickly processes and broadcasts targeting data. This ancient piece of technology allows one member of a Space Marine squad to fire with even greater accuracy, battering vital targets with a hail of unerring shots.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/ActOfFaithDescription
entry.value: Act of Faith. Usable if the unit is not shaken or broken.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/BeaconOfFaith
entry.value: Beacon of Faith

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/BeaconOfFaithDescription
entry.value: Restore the morale of this unit and nearby allied units.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/BeaconOfFaithFlavor
entry.value:
“The Khornate warriors threatened to overwhelm us, we were cut and rent and thrown aside… even the Canoness fell… and then She intervened. As She descended, a shining beacon, our wounds closed, our spirits rallied and we drove back the heretics with newfound devotion…”
— Unknown remembrancer, Gospel of the Webway

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/BodyguardDescription
entry.value: Grants additional protection to adjacent allied heroes.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/BodyguardFlavor
entry.value: Celestians are those Sisters most filled with martial spirit, proving themselves in the most intense melees. They frequently serve as bodyguards and champions of Canonesses, willingly sacrificing themselves to protect their charge.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/CatechismOfRepugnance
entry.value: Catechism of Repugnance

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/CatechismOfRepugnanceDescription
entry.value: Increases the ranged accuracy and ranged armor penetration of the target Adepta Sororitas allied unit.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/CatechismOfRepugnanceFlavor
entry.value: With the holy bolter we shall cleanse the mutant, the alien and the heretic. With the Emperor’s gift do we deliver our hatred of the defiler.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/ChaseTheProfane
entry.value: Chase the Profane

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/ChaseTheProfaneDescription
entry.value: Sacred Rite that grants Move Through Cover to infantry units.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/ChaseTheProfaneFlavor
entry.value:
“And the faithful shall be relentless in their inquisition. Nothing shall stand in the way of their will; neither the laws of men nor xenos; not qualms nor friends; not steel nor plascrete nor adamantium.”
— Canoness Vandire, In Memoriam De Virtute

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/ConvictionOfFaith
entry.value: Conviction of Faith

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/ConvictionOfFaithDescription
entry.value: Sacred Rite that restores the morale of units with Shield of Faith.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/ConvictionOfFaithFlavor
entry.value:
“In the age since our disgrace, not one of us has fallen. We do not struggle with our qualms as other do, nor fall to the dark path. Repeat: I know no fear for I am already death.”
— Canoness Vandire, “The Rite of Conviction” from In Memoriam De Virtute

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/DeathBeforeDisgrace
entry.value: Death Before Disgrace

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/DeathBeforeDisgraceDescription
entry.value: Restores the morale of the target allied unit.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/DeathBeforeDisgraceFlavor
entry.value:
“What is death, to us? We are not fodder for laughing gods. We are not enshrined in stones, like the foul Aeldari. For us death is an end to service, a reward only given if we do not seek it. So act as if each moment is your last, but strive against that day with all your heart.”
— Canoness Vandire, In Memoriam De Virtute

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/DivineDeliverance
entry.value: Divine Deliverance

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/DivineDeliveranceDescription
entry.value: This unit and adjacent allied Adepta Sororitas units cause attacked units to lose morale.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/DivineDeliveranceFlavor
entry.value: Enemy warlords tremble before the divine majesty of one blessed by the Emperor, and their minions quake before the booming onslaught of such a warrior’s companions.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/DivineGuidance
entry.value: Divine Guidance

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/DivineGuidanceDescription
entry.value: Increases the damage and armour penetration.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/DivineGuidanceFlavor
entry.value: As the combatants of the sorority recite rites of destruction, their aim faithfully falls where it will cause the most harm – every shot and every strike becoming a mortal blow that condemns another heretic to oblivion.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/EndlessCrusade
entry.value: Endless Crusade

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/EndlessCrusadeDescription
entry.value: Gains Fleet and Move Through Cover.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/EndlessCrusadeFlavor
entry.value: Limbs do not tire when the spirit of the Emperor moves them, but find fresh strength in the righteous work to come.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/EternalCrusade
entry.value: <string name='Traits/SistersOfBattle/EternalCrusade'/>

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/EternalCrusadeDescription
entry.value: Sacred Rite that increases the production output of Battle Chapels and Legatines' Priories.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/EternalCrusadeFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Traits/SistersOfBattle/EternalCrusadeFlavor'/>

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/FlankSpeed
entry.value: <string name='Traits/SistersOfBattle/FlankSpeed'/>

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/FlankSpeedDescription
entry.value: <string name='Traits/SistersOfBattle/FlankSpeedDescription'/>

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/FlankSpeedFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Traits/SistersOfBattle/FlankSpeedFlavor'/>

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/HealingTears
entry.value: Healing Tears

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/HealingTearsDescription
entry.value: Restores a portion of Saint Celestine's hitpoints.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/HealingTearsFlavor
entry.value:
“And, lo, the tears were human, tears for her lost sisters, tears for the endless war—but they were transfigured in their descent and where they struck, they blessed. And the Saint herself roused herself up with righteous fury…”
— Unknown remembrancer, Gospel of the Webway

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/IonGauntletShield
entry.value: Ion Gauntlet Shield

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/IonGauntletShieldDescription
entry.value: Reduces the melee accuracy of adjacent gargantuan creatures and super-heavy walkers.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/IonGauntletShieldFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Traits/SistersOfBattle/IonGauntletShieldFlavor'/>

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/KeepersOfTheFaith
entry.value: Keepers of the Faith

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/KeepersOfTheFaithDescription
entry.value: Prevents overwatch but increases the damage reduction if this unit has actions remaining.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/KeepersOfTheFaithFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Traits/SistersOfBattle/KeepersOfTheFaithFlavor'/>

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/LaudHailer
entry.value: Laud Hailer

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/LaudHailerDescription
entry.value: Adjacent Adepta Sororitas units can perform Acts of Faith even if they are shaken.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/LaudHailerFlavor
entry.value: Proclaiming the power of the Emperor in heavenly tones, a Laud Hailer bolsters the spirits of the faithful.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/LeadTheRighteous
entry.value: Lead The Righteous

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/LeadTheRighteousDescription
entry.value: Increases the accuracy of this unit and nearby allied Adepta Sororitas infantry units.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/LeadTheRighteousFlavor
entry.value:
“A Canoness is no skulking commissar, to hide behind her sisters’ skirts and send them to her deaths. My role is to lead from the front, to inspire love and faith by my example. For we are the righteous of the Emperor and we will not fail in our aim.”
— Canoness Vandire, In Memoriam De Virtute

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/LightOfTheEmperor
entry.value: Light of the Emperor

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/LightOfTheEmperorDescription
entry.value: Increases the accuracy.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/LightOfTheEmperorFlavor
entry.value: Sisters of the Adepta Sororitas are filled with the knowledge that the only thing they need fear is failing the Emperor of Mankind. Armed with such faith, they are driven to unprecedented feats of prowess.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/MedicusMinistorum
entry.value: Medicus Ministorum

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/MedicusMinistorumDescription
entry.value: Grants feel no pain damage reduction to adjacent allied infantry units.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/MedicusMinistorumFlavor
entry.value: A Medicus Ministorum is a medical field kit used by members of the Adeptus Ministorum and by the Hospitallers of the Adepta Sororitas. Contained within a rare scentwood box are a collection of relics which are used to cure all manner of injuries and ailments.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/MiraculousIntervention
entry.value: Miraculous Intervention

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/MiraculousInterventionDescription
entry.value: After dying, Saint Celestine immediately comes back to life.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/MiraculousInterventionFlavor
entry.value: Not even death can stop the Emperor’s chosen servants, and through his benevolence they rise again to serve the Master of Mankind’s will.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/NonMilitantMobilisation
entry.value: <string name='Traits/SistersOfBattle/NonMilitantMobilisation'/>

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/NonMilitantMobilisationDescription
entry.value: Sacred Rite that increases the requisitions output in cities.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/NonMilitantMobilisationFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Traits/SistersOfBattle/NonMilitantMobilisationFlavor'/>

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/PurifyingRecitations
entry.value: <string name='Traits/SistersOfBattle/PurifyingRecitations'/>

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/PurifyingRecitationsDescription
entry.value: Sacred Rite that increases the damage of flame and melta weapons.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/PurifyingRecitationsFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Traits/SistersOfBattle/PurifyingRecitationsFlavor'/>

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/RagingFervour
entry.value: <string name='Traits/SistersOfBattle/RagingFervour'/>

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/RagingFervourDescription
entry.value: Sacred Rite that increases the damage of bolt weapons.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/RagingFervourFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Traits/SistersOfBattle/RagingFervourFlavor'/>

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/RighteousJudgement
entry.value: Righteous Judgement

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/RighteousJudgementDescription
entry.value: Ignores ranged damage reduction and increases damage taken by the target enemy unit.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/RighteousJudgementFlavor
entry.value: None can escape the Emperor’s judgement, and wherever the foe attempts to seek shelter the shots of the Adepta Sororitas miraculously seek them out.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/SacralVigor
entry.value: Sacral Vigor

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/SacralVigorDescription
entry.value: Sacred Rite that restores the hitpoints of units with Shield of Faith.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/SacralVigorFlavor
entry.value:
“What of these wounds upon us, sisters? Is our flesh that precious to us, our beauty that sacred? Tear at these cuts, open them, they are but motes in fanciful air. Never forget that our reality is faith, and pain, like life, is evanescent…”
— Canoness Vandire, In Memoriam De Virtute

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/SacredHealing
entry.value: Sacred Healing

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/SacredHealingDescription
entry.value: Restores the hitpoints of the target allied infantry unit.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/SacredHealingFlavor
entry.value: Implements of both torture and salvation, the chirurgeon’s tools can restore the fallen so that they might fight once more.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/SaintlyBlessings
entry.value: Saintly Blessings

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/SaintlyBlessingsDescription
entry.value: Grants additional damage reduction to this unit and adjacent allied units.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/SaintlyBlessingsFlavor
entry.value: In the presence of an ordained Living Saint, even the most impious of the Emperor’s servants cannot help but be swept up by the tide of religious fervour.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/SolaceInAnguish
entry.value: Solace in Anguish

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/SolaceInAnguishDescription
entry.value: Increases the damage reduction.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/SolaceInAnguishFlavor
entry.value:
“I had seen a Preacher impaled on a steeple. The remains of a missionary found by genestealer cultists. We felt the loss so strongly—but our anguish did not weaken us, but spurred us on…”
— Unknown remembrancer, Gospel of the Webway

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/StirringRhetoric
entry.value: Stirring Rhetoric

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/StirringRhetoricDescription
entry.value: This unit and nearby allied units that used an Act of Faith gain additional armor.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/StirringRhetoricFlavor
entry.value:
“There is no light but the light of the Emperor! There is no faith but faith in the Emperor! There is no truth but the truth of the Emperor!”
— First Exclamation of the Dialogus Order of the Resounding Vow

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/TaleOfTheFaithful
entry.value: Tale of the Faithful

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/TaleOfTheFaithfulDescription
entry.value: Increases the movement of this unit and adjacent Adepta Sororitas infantry units.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/TaleOfTheFaithfulFlavor
entry.value: From a young age, the initiates of the Adepta Sororitas exercise and pray backed by the sonorous songs of the Imagifiers, inspired to superhuman feats by the testaments of their long-dead sisters. Even cynical veterans, hearing the song in their dotage, are inspired to transcend their body’s limitations, moving with impossible swiftness and blessed grace.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/TaleOfTheStoic
entry.value: Tale of the Stoic

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/TaleOfTheStoicDescription
entry.value: Increases the damage reduction of this unit and adjacent Adepta Sororitas infantry units.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/TaleOfTheStoicFlavor
entry.value: Hearing the stories of the Emperor’s eternal suffering and silent resilience, each Sister is filled with His courage. Their will-to-fight in His name is indefatigable and they push through injuries so grievous that an average man would be long-dead from shock. Yet they are neither average nor men.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/TaleOfTheWarrior
entry.value: Tale of the Warrior

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/TaleOfTheWarriorDescription
entry.value: Increases the melee damage of adjacent Adepta Sororitas infantry units.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/TaleOfTheWarriorFlavor
entry.value: When the Imagifiers chant their tales of ancient battles of Istvaan V, of Sanguinius at the Eternity Gate, of Horus’ downfall, the Battle Sisters become suffused with the martial spirit of their forebears, every blow landing like the Emperor’s fist.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/TheEmperorsVengeance
entry.value: The Emperor's Vengeance

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/TheEmperorsVengeanceDescription
entry.value: Calls down a divine ray to bombard enemy positions.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/TheEmperorsVengeanceFlavor
entry.value:
“This was not in the doctrines, nor the ephemera, nor even the apocrypha. This planet had drained the Saint, it is true. But at moments of great wrath, her true power broke through, all at once, and devastated those who dared to stand against her.”
— Unknown remembrancer, Gospel of the Webway

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/ThePassion
entry.value: The Passion

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/ThePassionDescription
entry.value: Increases the melee accuracy of the Canoness and adjacent allied units.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/ThePassionFlavor
entry.value: A Canoness leads her Sisters through the chaos of melee, striking at their foes with a speed and hatred born of holy fervour.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/VengefulSpirit
entry.value: <string name='Traits/SistersOfBattle/VengefulSpirit'/>

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/VengefulSpiritDescription
entry.value: Sacred Rite that returns damage back to the enemy attacker.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/VengefulSpiritFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Traits/SistersOfBattle/VengefulSpiritFlavor'/>

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/VerseOfHolyPiety
entry.value: Verse of Holy Piety

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/VerseOfHolyPietyDescription
entry.value: Reduces the cooldown of Acts of Faith on the target unit.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/VerseOfHolyPietyFlavor
entry.value: Pray is stronger than any sword. As the sanctified words of the Order’s holy tenets are roared across the battlefield, the devout are infused with the Emperor’s blessings.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/WarHymn
entry.value: War Hymn

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/WarHymnDescription
entry.value: Increases the melee attacks of the target Adepta Sororitas non-super-heavy allied unit.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/WarHymnFlavor
entry.value: Suffer not the enemies of Mankind to live. Smite them down with all your strength and fury.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/WarmachinesWrath
entry.value: <string name='Traits/SistersOfBattle/WarmachinesWrath'/>

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/WarmachinesWrathDescription
entry.value: Sacred Rite that increases the production output of Anointed Hangars and Ecclesiarchal Reinforcements.

entry.name: SistersOfBattle/WarmachinesWrathFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Traits/SistersOfBattle/WarmachinesWrathFlavor'/>

entry.name: SkilledJink
entry.value: Skilled Jink

entry.name: SkilledJinkDescription
entry.value: <string name='Actions/JinkDescription'/>

entry.name: SkilledJinkFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Actions/JinkFlavor'/>

entry.name: SkipDescription
entry.value: Skips the turn.

entry.name: SleepDescription
entry.value: Sleeps production until canceled.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/OmniscopeDescription
entry.value: Ignores enemy ranged damage reduction.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/OmniscopeFlavor
entry.value: Centurions make use of omniscopes to better direct their fearsome firepower and pierce the gloom of a hostile galaxy.

entry.name: SpaceSlip
entry.value: Space Slip

entry.name: SpaceSlipDescription
entry.value: Increases damage reduction.

entry.name: SpawnUnits
entry.value: Spawn %1%

entry.name: SpawnUnitsHint
StrikeAndShroud
entry.value: “Strike and Shroud!”

entry.name: StrikeAndShroudDescription
entry.value: Creates a smoke screen on the tile of the Tank Commander and adjacent tiles with allied tanks that provides ranged damage reduction.

entry.name: SummaryExecution
entry.value: Summary Execution

entry.name: SummaryExecutionDescription
entry.value: Executes a squad member of an adjacent infantry unit to restore morale of nearby allied units.

entry.name: SummaryExecutionFlavor
entry.value: In extremis, a Commissar must be prepared to execute wavering soldiers or incompetent officers without a moment's remorse; few things enforce discipline better than a malcontent or coward being shot dead for their failings, and this message is all the stronger when a mass-reactive bolt shell sprays a Guardsman's brains across his horrified comrades in a shower of gore.

entry.name: SupersonicDescription
entry.value: Increases the movement.

entry.name: SupersonicFlavor
entry.value: Supersonic vehicles are supremely fast, even by the normal standards of aircraft, making them exceptionally mobile in battle.

entry.name: TacticalDoctrine
entry.value: Deploy Tactical Doctrine

entry.name: TacticalDoctrineDescription
entry.value: Chapter tactic that increases the accuracy of Tactical Space Marines.

entry.name: TacticalDoctrineFlavor
entry.value:
“They shall be pure of heart and strong of body, untainted by doubt and unsullied by self-aggrandisement. They will be bright stars on the firmament of battle, Angels of Death whose shining wings bring swift annihilation to the enemies of Man. So it shall be for a thousand times for a thousand years, unto the very end of eternity and the extinction of mortal flesh.”
— Codex Astartes, by Roboute Guilliman, Primarch of the Ultramarines, Lord Commander and Imperial Regent

entry.name: Tau/AdvancedTargetingSystem
entry.value: Install <string name='Traits/Tau/AdvancedTargetingSystem'/>

entry.name: Tau/AdvancedTargetingSystemDescription
entry.value: Installs support system that increases the ranged accuracy.

entry.name: Tau/AdvancedTargetingSystemFlavor
entry.value: An advanced targeting system assists the vehicle's gunner by identifying targets of particular value or danger and plotting fire plans to counter them.

entry.name: Tau/BondingKnifeRitual
entry.value: Bonding Knife Ritual

entry.name: Tau/BondingKnifeRitualDescription
entry.value: Restores the morale.

entry.name: Tau/BondingKnifeRitualFlavor
entry.value: Many T'au groupings undergo the solemn and bloody ceremony known as the ta'lissera. Those teams that share this bond swear to support one another at all costs for the rest of their lives.

entry.name: Tau/BreakComposure
entry.value: Break Composure

entry.name: Tau/BreakComposureDescription
entry.value: This unit and adjacent allied infantry units cause attacked units to lose morale.

entry.name: Tau/BreakComposureFlavor
entry.value: Though not physically impressive, the T’au can inculcate fear in their enemies through subtler means—by harrying them so that they can’t focus, by surrounding them, by forcing them down tactical paths that only lead to repeated failure. Sometimes you don’t need to even touch an enemy to defeat them.

entry.name: Tau/CalmOfTides
entry.value: Calm of Tides

entry.name: Tau/CalmOfTidesDescription
entry.value: Restores the hitpoints of the Ethereal and adjacent allied T'au infantry and monstrous creatures.

entry.name: Tau/CalmOfTidesFlavor
entry.value:
“Wait a moment. Breathe. Do not hurry to their salvation. All will come to the T’au eventually. Alive or dead.”
— Aun’Dak’E, Curator of Spirit

entry.name: Tau/ConvertWildlife
entry.value: Convert Auxiliary

entry.name: Tau/ConvertWildlifeDescription
entry.value: Converts a unit of Kroot Hounds or Vespid Stingwings to your side. Enslaved units cannot be converted. Cost scales with target strength.

entry.name: Tau/ConvertWildlifeFlavor
entry.value:
“Soldiers of the Fire Caste! Kroot and Vespid allies! Today, we stand as a bulwark against the selfish, the soulless, and the mad!”
— Aun'el Shi'ores, at the loss of Kronus

entry.name: Tau/CounterfireDefenceSystem
entry.value: Install <string name='Traits/Tau/CounterfireDefenceSystem'/>

entry.name: Tau/CounterfireDefenceSystemDescription
entry.value: Installs support system that increases the accuracy of overwatch attacks.

entry.name: Tau/CounterfireDefenceSystemFlavor
entry.value: These AI sensor suites incorporate predictive logic circuits to ensure that assaulting enemies are met with a withering hail of fire.

entry.name: Tau/DeployDrone
entry.value: Deploy %1%

entry.name: Tau/DeployDroneDescription
entry.value:
Deploys temporary %1%. Shares cooldown with other drone deployment abilities.

%2%

entry.name: Tau/DroneController
entry.value: Install <string name='Traits/Tau/DroneController'/>

entry.name: Tau/DroneControllerDescription
entry.value: Installs support system that increases the accuracy of adjacent drones.

entry.name: Tau/DroneControllerFlavor
entry.value: A Drone controller acts as an interface between a Fire caste operator and the AI battle programs of nearby drones.

entry.name: Tau/ForTheGreaterGood
entry.value: For The Greater Good

entry.name: Tau/ForTheGreaterGoodDescription
entry.value: Reduces target enemy unit's morale. Cost scales with target strength.

entry.name: Tau/ForTheGreaterGoodFlavor
entry.value:
“There are two kinds of conduct the Ethereals will not countenance. The first is a failure to reflect upon what is for the Greater Good of the T'au race. The second is the deliberate refusal to follow the path of the Greater Good when it is clear what it must be.”
— Por'ui Dal'yth Ukos, water caste envoy

entry.name: Tau/GravityWaveProjector
entry.value: Gravity Wave Projector

entry.name: Tau/GravityWaveProjectorDescription
entry.value: Prevents unit movement on target tile.

entry.name: Tau/GravityWaveProjectorFlavor
entry.value: This projector emits a high-powered graviton wave that repulses nearby enemies, slowing their advance to a crawl.

entry.name: Tau/HolophotonCountermeasures
entry.value: Holophoton Countermeasures

entry.name: Tau/HolophotonCountermeasuresDescription
entry.value: Decreases the ranged accuracy of target enemy unit.

entry.name: Tau/HolophotonCountermeasuresFlavor
entry.value: Triggered by AI-assisted threat-warning protocols, holophoton countermeasures take the form of a targeted barrage of holo-decoys, friendly target simulacra and stroboscopic blasts. Enemy weapons are confounded, safety-switches engaging and machine spirits rebelling while their operators are left bewildered and blinded by the overwhelming sensory overload.

entry.name: Tau/Kauyon
entry.value: Kauyon (Patient Hunter)

entry.name: Tau/KauyonDescription
entry.value: Metastrategy that increases the ranged damage reduction of allied T'au units in the area. Shares cooldown with other metastrategies.

entry.name: Tau/KauyonFlavor
entry.value:
“Your troops are losing. They fall back! They flee! The enemy pursues, hungry for our valourous blood! Everything is lost… then your troops turn and fire. You reveal the flanking troops. And your enemy is in a pocket, encircled. The patient hunter triumphs.”
— Tutor Falsemoon

entry.name: Tau/MarkerlightDescription
entry.value: Increases the ranged accuracy of T'au against the target enemy non-fortification unit. Reduces the ranged damage reduction of the target enemy non-fortification unit against T'au. Ends after the target enemy unit is attacked by T'au.

entry.name: Tau/MarkerlightFlavor
entry.value: A markerlight is a hand-held device that projects a simple beam onto a target which then transmits a torrent of targeting data to other T'au units, allowing them to engage the target with unerring accuracy.

entry.name: Tau/Montka
entry.value: Mont'ka (Killing Blow)

entry.name: Tau/MontkaDescription
entry.value: Metastrategy that increases the damage of allied T'au units in the area against enemy units below 50% hitpoints. Shares cooldown with other metastrategies.

entry.name: Tau/MontkaFlavor
entry.value:
“Your enemy builds his force carefully. At its centre, lie his core units. You feign weakness. You draw them out. And you focus your fire on them. Without them, the enemy is lost. Cut off the head, the beast dies. Well, except for Be’gel.”
— Tutor Falsemoon

entry.name: Tau/NovaBoost
entry.value: Nova Boost

entry.name: Tau/NovaBoostDescription
entry.value: Sacrifices hitpoints to increase the movement.

entry.name: Tau/NovaBoostFlavor
entry.value: Though slightly unstable, the nova reactor is a dark-matter power source with an output akin to that of a small star.

entry.name: Tau/NovaElectromagneticShockwave
entry.value: Nova Electromagnetic Shockwave

entry.name: Tau/NovaElectromagneticShockwaveDescription
entry.value: Sacrifices hitpoints to do a special attack that targets adjacent enemies and allies alike.

entry.name: Tau/NovaElectromagneticShockwaveFlavor
entry.value: The experimental Nova Reactors are only used on a handful of Battlesuit designs. Damage cannot be avoided from their use, but sometimes they must be employed for the Greater Good to supercharge offensive or defensive weapon systems—or, as here, to render the Battlesuit’s local area utterly lethal with a burst of raw power.

entry.name: Tau/NovaFire
entry.value: Nova Fire

entry.name: Tau/NovaFireDescription
entry.value: Sacrifices hitpoints to increase the attacks.

entry.name: Tau/NovaFireFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Actions/Tau/NovaBoostFlavor'/>

entry.name: Tau/NovaShield
entry.value: Nova Shield

entry.name: Tau/NovaShieldDescription
entry.value: Sacrifices hitpoints to increase the damage reduction.

entry.name: Tau/NovaShieldFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Actions/Tau/NovaBoostFlavor'/>

entry.name: Tau/PreciseShot
entry.value: Precise Shot

entry.name: Tau/PreciseShotDescription
entry.value: Performs an uncompromising Pulse Rifle attack with increased accuracy, damage and range.

entry.name: Tau/PreciseShotFlavor
entry.value:
“I’m not going to teach you a special deathblow. I’m not going to give you a bigger gun. I’m not going to surround you with magic shield drones willing to die for you. But I am going to teach you to shoot straight, under fire, together. That immediately makes you better than every last Gue’la.”
— Tutor Sharptongue

entry.name: Tau/PulseAccelerator
entry.value: Pulse Accelerator

entry.name: Tau/PulseAcceleratorDescription
entry.value: Increases the range of pulse weapons of target allied unit.

entry.name: Tau/PulseAcceleratorFlavor
entry.value: This device emits a powerful induction field that accelerates the charges of pulse weapons, increasing their range.

entry.name: Tau/PurchaseEnergy
entry.value: Equal Under The Sky

entry.name: Tau/PurchaseEnergyDescription
entry.value: Purchases energy.

entry.name: Tau/PurchaseEnergyFlavor
entry.value: In the ruins of Gladius Prime, a billion people still live. Though war rages about them, though monstrosities erase their towns, they persist—and those who recognize them, understand them and help them, will receive help in return.

entry.name: Tau/PurchaseFood
entry.value: Many Mouths

entry.name: Tau/PurchaseFoodDescription
entry.value: Purchases food.

entry.name: Tau/PurchaseFoodFlavor
entry.value: The billion survivors of Gladius’ hive cities live hand-to-mouth—but they survive. They dine on scavenged supplies, farmed crops, secret soylent vats, foraged ash clams and hunted canids. Convince them to join the T’au and they will share their feast.

entry.name: Tau/PurchaseOre
entry.value: A Shield For All

entry.name: Tau/PurchaseOreDescription
entry.value: Purchases ore.

entry.name: Tau/PurchaseOreFlavor
entry.value: Outside of Imperial oversight, the billion survivors of Gladius may be in constant threat of starvation, death or corruption, but they also have their first ever free time. Bring them to the T’au, and they may spend it scavenging ore and scrap from the fallen hives for you.

entry.name: Tau/PurchasePopulationDescription
entry.value: Increases the population of target allied T'au city.

entry.name: Tau/PurchasePopulationFlavor
entry.value: Outside in the wastes, live the billion survivors of Gladius Prime. But the T’au doesn’t discriminate against the gue’la—should you persuade them to join, they will surely contribute to our city and save this world.

entry.name: Tau/PurchaseResearch
entry.value: Wisdom Shared

entry.name: Tau/PurchaseResearchDescription
entry.value: Purchases research.

entry.name: Tau/PurchaseResearchFlavor
entry.value: The Imperium’s technology may be archaic and strange, but the Earth Caste will never cease learning. If the Water Caste can persuade just a handful of Tech-priests to join our cause, their knowledge could supplement ours—could enable even more rapid advances in our technology.

entry.name: Tau/Rinyon
entry.value: Rinyon (Circle of Blades)

entry.name: Tau/RinyonDescription
entry.value: Metastrategy that increases the accuracy of allied T'au units in the area against enemy units adjacent to other allied units. Shares cooldown with other metastrategies.

entry.name: Tau/RinyonFlavor
entry.value:
“Your enemy encircles you. His troops are close. Too close. Your targeting network assigns every Fire Caste a victim, not his neighbour. You fire as one, every shot strikes, they fall as one. A distracted enemy is as good as dead.”
— Tutor Falsemoon

entry.name: Tau/Ripyka
entry.value: Rip'yka (Thousand Daggers)

entry.name: Tau/RipykaDescription
entry.value: Reduces the cooldown of the Commander's metastrategies.

entry.name: Tau/RipykaFlavor
entry.value:
“The enemy’s armour is thick, your blade makes only a scratch. In his arrogance, he allows you to strike. Hit the same spot, ten, a hundred, a thousand times. That scratch becomes a dent becomes a hole becomes his death. Water erodes the stone.”
— Tutor Falsemoon

entry.name: Tau/ProjectShield
entry.value: Project Shield

entry.name: Tau/ProjectShieldDescription
entry.value: Increases the damage reduction of target allied unit.

entry.name: Tau/ProjectShieldFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Units/Tau/ShieldDroneFlavor'/>

entry.name: Tau/SenseOfStone
entry.value: Sense of Stone

entry.name: Tau/SenseOfStoneDescription
entry.value: Increases the damage reduction of the Ethereal and adjacent allied T'au infantry and monstrous creatures. Shares cooldown with Storm of Fire.

entry.name: Tau/SenseOfStoneFlavor
entry.value:
“There are only four thoughts the Fire Caste must know. Knowing when to hide. Knowing when to defend. Knowing when to mislead. And knowing when to strike. Ask nothing more.”
— Aun’Dak’E, Curator of Spirit

entry.name: Tau/ShieldGenerator
entry.value: Install <string name='Traits/Tau/ShieldGenerator'/>

entry.name: Tau/ShieldGeneratorDescription
entry.value: Installs support system that increases the damage reduction.

entry.name: Tau/ShieldGeneratorFlavor
entry.value: This generator projects a choesive energy field capable of protecting the bearer from heavy ordnance and anti-tank weapons fire.

entry.name: Tau/StealthField
entry.value: Stealth Field

entry.name: Tau/StealthFieldDescription
entry.value: Increases the ranged damage reduction of target allied unit.

entry.name: Tau/StealthFieldFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Units/Tau/StealthDroneFlavor'/>

entry.name: Tau/StimulantInjector
entry.value: Install <string name='Traits/Tau/StimulantInjector'/>

entry.name: Tau/StimulantInjectorDescription
entry.value: Installs support system that increases the damage reduction.

entry.name: Tau/StimulantInjectorFlavor
entry.value: The battlesuit is fitted with an advanced life-support system that is able to flood the warrior's system with analgesic drugs and life-sustaining stimulants should he become wounded.

entry.name: Tau/StormOfFire
entry.value: Storm of Fire

entry.name: Tau/StormOfFireDescription
entry.value: Increases the attacks of the Ethereal and adjacent allied T'au infantry and monstrous creatures. Shares cooldown with Sense of Stone.

entry.name: Tau/StormOfFireFlavor
entry.value:
“It burns so briefly, the light of my children, so briefly. But, by the Greater Good, it burns so bright!”
— Aun’Va, Master of the Undying Spirit

entry.name: Tau/SubvertCity
entry.value: Subvert City

entry.name: Tau/SubvertCityDescription
entry.value: Reduces the loyalty of target enemy city. Cost scales with target population.

entry.name: Tau/SubvertCityFlavor
entry.value:
“What’s that? You call that a house!? Someone lives in that?! Oh my. Well, it shows just how brave you all are. Your masters know you don’t need proper shelter or water or food or sleep or rest to die doing your jobs, for the ‘Great Emperator’! If he even exists. Anyway, if you change your mind about joining the T’au, do let me know.”
— Por'el Dal'kor Slytongue, water caste emissary

entry.name: Tau/UnityDescription
entry.value: Increases the loyalty output of all cities.

entry.name: Tau/UnityFlavor
entry.value: Though the Commanders are the icons of T’au propaganda, it is the Fireblades who are quietly regarded as the true heroes—warriors good enough to don Battle Suits who choose instead to stay with the rank and file, training them for the Greater Good. They are the true inspirations.

entry.name: Tau/VectoredRetroThrusters
entry.value: Install <string name='Traits/Tau/VectoredRetroThrusters'/>

entry.name: Tau/VectoredRetroThrustersDescription
entry.value: Installs support system that increases the movement and allows the unit to ignore enemy zone of control.

entry.name: Tau/VectoredRetroThrustersFlavor
entry.value: The warrior's battlesuit is equipped with supplemental thruster nozzles, allowing him a degree of additional manoeuvrability.

entry.name: Tau/VelocityTracker
entry.value: Install <string name='Traits/Tau/VelocityTracker'/>

entry.name: Tau/VelocityTrackerDescription
entry.value: Installs support system that increases the ranged accuracy against flyers.

entry.name: Tau/VelocityTrackerFlavor
entry.value: These advanced motion-detecting and heat-seeking sensor systems allow pilots to track the movements of airborne targets.

entry.name: Tau/VolleyFire
entry.value: Volley Fire

entry.name: Tau/VolleyFireDescription
entry.value: Increases the ranged attacks of this unit and adjacent allied infantry units that have not moved.

entry.name: Tau/VolleyFireFlavor
entry.value: Under the constant eye of their Tutor, Fire Caste units learn to take cover, wait for the right moment and fire as one. The resulting volley of pulsed energy hits like neon fireworks and can thoroughly demoralize enemies.

entry.name: Tau/ZephyrsGrace
entry.value: Zephyr's Grace

entry.name: Tau/ZephyrsGraceDescription
entry.value: Increases the action points of this unit and adjacent allied T'au infantry and monstrous creatures.

entry.name: Tau/ZephyrsGraceFlavor
entry.value:
“Let none doubt that the Tau Empire will bring unity to all – let none doubt that now is our time. Forward, for the Greater Good!”
— Aun’Va, Master of the Undying Spirit

entry.name: TelekineDome
entry.value: Telekine Dome

entry.name: TelekineDomeDescription
entry.value: Creates a barrier on the tile of the Librarian and adjacent tiles that increases the ranged damage reduction.

entry.name: TelekineDomeFlavor
entry.value: Bullets bounce off of thin air and are deflected harmlessly away as the psyker erects a barrier of shimmering energy about himself.

entry.name: TheFleshIsWeak
entry.value: Deploy The Flesh Is Weak

entry.name: TheFleshIsWeakDescription
entry.value: Chapter tactic that increases damage reduction of infantry units.

entry.name: TheFleshIsWeakFlavor
entry.value:
“We have been wounded sorely. Yet still we stand, with fire in our eyes and valour in our hearts. Let them think us beaten. We shall teach them otherwise.”
— Pedro Kantor, Chapter Master of the Crimson Fists

entry.name: TurboBoostDescription
entry.value: Increases the movement.

entry.name: Tyranids/AcquireTile
entry.value: Acquire Tile (Tyranids)

entry.name: Tyranids/AcquireTileDescription
entry.value: Acquires a new tile for the city, consuming its biomass, removing forests and turning the ground into bedrock. Buildings can only be built on acquired tiles. Each tile has an influence upkeep.

entry.name: Tyranids/AdaptiveBiology
entry.value: Adaptive Biology

entry.name: Tyranids/AdaptiveBiologyDescription
entry.value: Increases the feel no pain damage reduction for the turn after taking damage.

entry.name: Tyranids/AdaptiveBiologyFlavor
entry.value: This hero has been created to adapt against the weaponry used by the current prey world's defenders.

entry.name: Tyranids/AlphaWarrior
entry.value: Alpha Warrior

entry.name: Tyranids/AlphaWarriorDescription
entry.value: Increases the accuracy of allied Tyranid Warriors in range.

entry.name: Tyranids/AlphaWarriorFlavor
entry.value:
“To think that Tyranids are mindless beasts is a grave mistake. When you fight Tyranids you face not only those before you on the battlefield, but the untold thousands which seek to surround you, which attack your supporting units and destroy your supply lines in perfect synchronicity.”
— Marneus Calgar, Chapter Master of the Ultramarines

entry.name: Tyranids/BroodProgenitor
entry.value: Brood Progenitor

entry.name: Tyranids/BroodProgenitorDescription
entry.value: Increases the attacks of allied Termagants.

entry.name: Tyranids/BroodProgenitorFlavor
entry.value:
“This horror, this abomination, has thought and purpose that functions on an unimaginable, galactic scale and all we can do is try to stop the swarms of bioengineered monsters it unleashes upon us by instinct. We have given the horror a name to salve our fears; we call it the Tyranid race, but if it is aware of us at all it must know us only as Prey.”
— Inquisitor Czevak

entry.name: Tyranids/CatalystDescription
entry.value: Restores the hitpoints of the Tervigon and target allied Tyranids unit.

entry.name: Tyranids/CatalystFlavor
entry.value: Through its synaptic conduits, the power of the Hive Mind reaches out to infuse the organisms under its control, invigorating their systems with such unnatural vitality that they can ignore the most grievous of wounds.

entry.name: Tyranids/ClearTile
entry.value: Clear Tile (Tyranids)

entry.name: Tyranids/ClearTileDescription
entry.value: Clears the tile of wire weed, holy sites, imperial ruins, and forests, one at a time.

entry.name: Tyranids/ConstructTunnel
entry.value: Construct <string name='Units/Tyranids/Tunnel'/>

entry.name: Tyranids/ConstructTunnelFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Units/Tyranids/TunnelFlavor'/>

entry.name: Tyranids/ConsumeTile
entry.value: Consume Tile

entry.name: Tyranids/ConsumeTileDescription
entry.value: Feeds upon the planet, consuming the tile's biomass, clearing forests and turning the ground into bedrock.

entry.name: Tyranids/ConsumeTileFlavor
entry.value: Rippers are experts at gathering biomass material of all sorts—but it takes heavier Tyranid support units, co-ordinated by a Malanthrope, to strip a planet of all its resources, leaving only bedrock behind.

entry.name: Tyranids/DiffusionField
entry.value: Diffusion Field

entry.name: Tyranids/DiffusionFieldDescription
entry.value: Increases the ranged damage reduction of adjacent allied tyranid units.

entry.name: Tyranids/DiffusionFieldFlavor
entry.value: In other theatres of war, genetors have noted that the thick cloud of spores emitted by Venomthropes obscure the sight of their enemies. The strain of Maleceptor on Gladius Prime has a similar diffusive effect on enemy attacks, albeit caused by the shadowy tendrils emanating from its encephalic tissue and their direct interference with the consciousness of the opposing troops.

entry.name: Tyranids/DominionDescription
entry.value: Increases the Synapse Link radius and the loyalty output of all cities.

entry.name: Tyranids/DominionFlavor
entry.value: The Tyranid uses its prodigious psychic strength to channel and amplify the will of the Hive Mind.

entry.name: Tyranids/ExploitWeaknesses
entry.value: Exploit Weaknesses

entry.name: Tyranids/ExploitWeaknessesDescription
entry.value: The Tyranid Prime reduces the armour of the target enemy unit.

entry.name: Tyranids/ExploitWeaknessesFlavor
entry.value:
“We retreat, we fall back, we make strategic withdrawals, we consolidate, we evacuate. When in the name of all that's holy are we going to fight back?”
— Commissar General Vortigus Hornth, Acting Warmaster; Diatan Sector, Ultima Segmentum

entry.name: Tyranids/GraspingTail
entry.value: Grasping Tail

entry.name: Tyranids/GraspingTailDescription
entry.value: Reduces the attacks of the target enemy unit.

entry.name: Tyranids/GraspingTailFlavor
entry.value: If a Malanthrope must engage in battle, it makes for a difficult foe. Its sinuous body is hard to strike, its grasping tail can immobilise foes or their weapons, and its feeder tendrils are highly poisonous, causing excruciating pain. If a foe becomes paralysed by its tendrils, the Malanthrope will begin to absorb it alive, to acquire the choicest, freshest genetic data.

entry.name: Tyranids/HiveCommander
entry.value: Hive Commander

entry.name: Tyranids/HiveCommanderDescription
entry.value: The Hive Tyrant increases the damage and damage reduction of allied Tyranid units in the area.

entry.name: Tyranids/HiveCommanderFlavor
entry.value:
“A new Tyrant joined the fray and, in an eyeblink, the whole character of the swarm changed. The ravening berserker-spirit that had driven the Tyranids onto the ridge was gone as if it had never existed. Left in its place was something cannier and infinitely more worrisome. It was then that I knew the battle to be lost.”
— Sergeant Torias Telion, Ultramarines 10th Company

entry.name: Tyranids/IndescribableHorror
entry.value: Indescribable Horror

entry.name: Tyranids/IndescribableHorrorDescription
entry.value: The Hive Tyrant reduces the morale of adjacent enemy units each turn.

entry.name: Tyranids/IndescribableHorrorFlavor
entry.value:
“We cannot live through this. Mankind cannot live through this. In a single day they have covered the surface of this planet with a flood of living blades and needle-fanged mouths. Kill one and ten take its place. If they are truly without number then our race is doomed to a violent death before every shred of our civilization is scoured away by a force more voracious than the fires of hell themselves! Death! By the Machine God, Death is here!”
— Magos Varnak, Overseer of the Tyran research station

entry.name: Tyranids/InstinctiveBehaviourOverride
entry.value: Override Instinctive Behaviour

entry.name: Tyranids/InstinctiveBehaviourOverrideDescription
entry.value: Focuses the Hive mind's attention to temporarily override instinctive behaviour.

entry.name: Tyranids/InstinctiveBehaviourOverrideFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Traits/Tyranids/InstinctiveBehaviourOverrideFlavor'/>

entry.name: Tyranids/LivingBatteringRam
entry.value: Living Battering Ram

entry.name: Tyranids/LivingBatteringRamDescription
entry.value: Increases the damage.

entry.name: Tyranids/LivingBatteringRamFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Actions/HammerOfWrathFlavor'/>

entry.name: Tyranids/LivingIncubator
entry.value: Living Incubator

entry.name: Tyranids/LivingIncubatorDescription
entry.value: Summons Termagants.

entry.name: Tyranids/LivingIncubatorFlavor
entry.value: A foe engaging a Tervigon up close will find itself assailed by waves of skittering Termagants. Such a confrontation is terrible to behold, for a Tervigon's capacity to reinforce is vast, and its broods are driven into a near-frenzy by the need to protect their progenitor.

entry.name: Tyranids/MassIncubation
entry.value: Mass Incubation

entry.name: Tyranids/MassIncubationDescription
entry.value: Reduces the cooldown of Living Incubator.

entry.name: Tyranids/MassIncubationFlavor
entry.value: Should a Tervigon need it, it can birth its entire brood rapidly. An opponent focused on this single opponent may find itself suddenly outnumbered.

entry.name: Tyranids/OnslaughtDescription
entry.value: Increases the movement of the Hive Tyrant and adjacent allied units.

entry.name: Tyranids/OnslaughtFlavor
entry.value: The synapse creature reaches out its mind and seizes control of the lesser creatures' weapon symbiotes, guiding their fire whilst simultaneously driving the swarms towards the enemy at a breakneck pace.

entry.name: Tyranids/ParoxysmDescription
entry.value: Reduces the accuracy of the target enemy unit.

entry.name: Tyranids/ParoxysmFlavor
entry.value: The Hive Mind debilitates its enemies by triggering every nerve and pain receptor in their bodies, overwhelming their senses with wracking fits of agony.

entry.name: Tyranids/PsychicOverload
entry.value: Psychic Overload

entry.name: Tyranids/PsychicOverloadDescription
entry.value: Special psychic attack that deals additional damage to enemy units with low morale.

entry.name: Tyranids/PsychicOverloadFlavor
entry.value: The psyker plunges tendrils of psychic energy into the target’s brain, causing it to explode!

entry.name: Tyranids/PsychicScream
entry.value: <string name='Weapons/PsychicScream'/>

entry.name: Tyranids/PsychicScreamFlavor
entry.value: <string name='Weapons/PsychicScreamFlavor'/>

entry.name: Tyranids/RapaciousHunger
entry.value: Rapacious Hunger

entry.name: Tyranids/RapaciousHungerDescription
entry.value: The Haruspex increases its attacks.

entry.name: Tyranids/RapaciousHungerFlavor
entry.value: To see a Haruspex in a full feeding frenzy is to recognise your life is already lost—not in the creature's jetbike-sized maw necessarily, but to what the Haruspex symbolises. These creatures are normally only deployed at the end of a planetary invasion—so to see them is to accept that your planet is almost certainly doomed.

entry.name: Tyranids/ReclaimUnit
entry.value: Reclaim Unit

entry.name: Tyranids/ReclaimUnitDescription
entry.value: Reclaim a Tyranid unit to regain biomass and production at the cost of influence.

entry.name: Tyranids/ReclaimUnitFlavor
entry.value: Though the Hive Mind normally only dispatches the worthless swarms of Rippers into its reclamation pools, in extremis it can render down any creature for its resources. On planets conquered by its Genestealer proxies, it's not unusual to see entire assimilated populations and defense platoons marching themselves happily into the digestive pools.

entry.name: Tyranids/ScourgeOfTheBrood
entry.value: Scourge of the Brood

entry.name: Tyranids/ScourgeOfTheBroodDescription
entry.value: The Tyranid Prime increases its damage.

entry.name: Tyranids/ScourgeOfTheBroodFlavor
entry.value:
“As I looked into its dead black eyes, I saw the terrible sentience it had in place of a soul. Behind that was the steel will of its leader. Further still I could feel its primogenitor coldly assessing me from the void. And looking back from the deepest recesses of the alien's mind I perceived what I can only describe as an immortal hunger.”
— Chief Librarian Varro Tigurius of the Ultramarines

entry.name: Tyranids/ShadowInTheWarp
entry.value: Shadow In The Warp

entry.name: Tyranids/ShadowInTheWarpDescription
entry.value: Reduces the morale of adjacent enemy psyker units each turn.

entry.name: Tyranids/ShadowInTheWarpFlavor
entry.value: The unfathomable presence of the Hive Mind radiates out from its synapse creatures, smothering the ability of the psykers who stand before them to draw upon their mystic powers.

entry.name: Tyranids/SporeCloud
entry.value: Spore Cloud

entry.name: Tyranids/SporeCloudDescription
entry.value: Increases the ranged damage reduction of this unit and adjacent allied units.

entry.name: Tyranids/SporeCloudFlavor
entry.value: The best possible tactic against Tyranids is decapitation—namely, the execution of the synapse creatures that relay the Norn Queen's commands. Unfortunately, through the fluid mass of sinuous flesh that constitutes a Tyranid assault, the hail of acidic and living projectiles, and the obfuscating spore clouds, even a Vindicare assassin would have trouble picking out a Dominatrix, let alone a Tyrant.

entry.name: Tyranids/SporeMine
entry.value: Spore Burst

entry.name: Tyranids/SporeMineDescription
entry.value: Create Spore Mines.

entry.name: Tyranids/SporeMineFlavor
entry.value: As the Spore Mine is flung through the air, its internal gas bladder inflates and it floats down towards ground level. Even if the shot misses its initial target, the danger it poses is far from over; for the Spore Mine is possessed of a rudimentary intelligence and detonates not on impact with the ground, but when it senses the proximity of a non-Tyranid life form.

entry.name: Tyranids/SubterraneanAssault
entry.value: Subterranean Assault

entry.name: Tyranids/SubterraneanAssaultDescription
entry.value: Tunnels from a Trygon's Broodhive to another Broodhive.

entry.name: Tyranids/SubterraneanAssaultFlavor
entry.value:
“How ironic it is that as fast as we spread progress and hope throughout the galaxy, the Tyranids spread death and despair. Only united can we hope to stand against them.”
— Aun'shi of the T'au Empire

entry.name: Tyranids/SynapseCreature
entry.value: Synapse Creature

entry.name: Tyranids/SynapseCreatureDescription
entry.value: Grants this and adjacent units immunity to morale, fear and instinctive behaviour effects.

entry.name: Tyranids/SynapseCreatureFlavor
entry.value: Some Tyranids serve as synaptic conduits or nodal relays through which a portion of the Hive Mind's iron will flows, overriding the natural instincts of the swarm.

entry.name: Tyranids/TheHorror
entry.value: The Horror

entry.name: Tyranids/TheHorrorDescription
entry.value: Reduces the movement and ranged accuracy, increases the ranged damage reduction and prevents the target enemy infantry unit from doing overwatch attacks.

entry.name: Tyranids/TheHorrorFlavor
entry.value: The terrifying psychic presence of the Hive Mind radiates from the synapse creature, flooding the minds of the Tyranids' enemies and causing them to quail and panic.

entry.name: VectoredAfterburners
entry.value: Vectored Afterburners

entry.name: VectoredAfterburnersDescription
entry.value: Increases the movement and ranged damage reduction.
